content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
 PROTOTYPE 2 – REVIEW    Graphics (Environment 8/10, Models 7/10) 7.5   Animations 6/10   Sound 7/10   Music 7/10   Story 6/10   Gameplay 7.5/10   Inovation 7/10   TOTAL SCORE 7  GraphicsOn the first sight on all settings maxed this game looks pretty nice, but after a couple of hours of gameplay the 'holes' of this game are starting to show ... but, sadly, not just in the graphics area.  AnimationsThe animations in this game are really disappointing, with bosses which have the same attack animations, people, enemies and soldiers that are just copies one of another. I think that Heller's animations are a small variety in a such 'copy-pasted' world.  Sound & MusicThe voice acting and other sounds in this game were not really impressive but neither that bad at all. StoryThe story of your character, James Heller, the war veteran who's been intentionally made into the one of the evolved by Alex Mercer seemed not that good at all. Actually there were some missions that had some kind of cleverness and some elements that looked promising, but sadly just for a short period of time, because they just sank in the sea of other unimaginative and boring missions - with just one goal: to clear all of the Mercer's companions and Mercer himself. End of story. Maybe the memory cut-scenes with which you progress in understading of the story and other side tasks and missions are the 'better part' and enjoyment of the whole game, not just the story. GameplayThe gameplay beside the graphics thankfully isn't the weakest part of the game and seemed improved since the first game. Running, jumping and gliding trough the map which is divided into three sectors never gets old. There are plenty upgrades to unlock, side missions to complete and other bonuses to finish, which really extends the time of finishing the game. Maybe the main problem is the fact, that you are overpowered to the most of the enemies - that's why deaths seem to happen only by an accident and not because of the 'difficulty' of the game.There isn't really much to do in the so called 'open world' beside completing the tasks that you are given. Using your abilities to beat or  'punish' other NPC's in a free roam mode gets quickly boring, because of their dull personality and poor mechanics. ConslusionPrototype 2 could be so much more of what it is, beacuse it inherited such a promising name and some in-game elements that showed the possibilities that could turned this game into a one of a kind gaming experience. But, unfortunately, because of so many unimaginative and (rather) bad shortcuts the overall feeling of this game just falls apart.Maybe there are reasons why is that and why we just can't give this game a score above mediocrity and put it on a shelf with other great and impressive titles.Replay value: NOT really.Recommended: Yes, but ONLY ON SALE!

content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
												Alright.I completed Prototype 2 less than 5 minutes ago, and Prototype 1, I've played probably more than 200 hours in total.Are they the same experience? NO. With a change of protagonist and a complete revamp of the abilities, upgrade system, and fighting mechanics, Prototype 1 and PRototype 2 are two very different (and both incredible) experiences.The Abilities.Instead of one ability equipped at a time, with a multitide of combos and attacks, P2 features 2 abilities assigned to Mouse Button 1 and 2. This makes combat simpler than P1, but not nessecarily better. P1 contains thousands of combinations to simply desecrate your enemies. P2 has much gorier attacks, special moves, and kill sequences, but P1 simply goes more in depth. If you wanna know more, play the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game.Upgrade System.Prototype 1 had a currency based upgrade system in which you would collect EP (Evolution Points) in ludicrous amounts and spend them on upgrades, of which there were, I believe, over 100. Prototype 2 features a leveling system, in which the EP (still present) acts as experience points. Upon leveling, the player chooses a single upgrade. Whether either one is better, I can't say, because I didn't have a problem with either of them. They were acceptable mechanics that did what they were meant to. Can you really ask for more?Fighting Mechanics.Incredible. Please just play it. It's Incredible.Story.In my opinion, P2's story was FAR better than P1. The original Prototype has more of a focus on the hack and slash, kill everything, be a total badass through ACTIONS. P2, on the other hand, has more of an emotional story, in which the character (still badass, still ♥♥♥♥s♥♥♥♥♥♥up) is less cold, and is more emotional. I felt more immersed with Heller than with Mercer.Final ThoughtsIf you can spare the funds, ♥♥♥♥ING BUY IT. If you can't, you better start a damn trust fund, because both Prototype 1 and Prototype 2 are excellent, amazing games that give 2 amazing experiences.SPOILER ALERTThe protagonist is black. Not once did I hear any sort of mention that he was black, nor did I hear a racial slur at any point. Nice. That's the way to go.RatingSure ok m8 i r8 8/8

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												I rather enjoyed the first Prototype game. It had its fair share of flaws, but few games let me feel as gosh-darn powerful. I could leap tall buildings in a single bound, bash a tank to pieces, run through a crowd of zombies leaving bloody chunks in my wake... what's not to love? So despite the mediocre reviews the sequel received, it was a no-brainer that game would end up in my library as well. And you know what? I'm glad it did. Like the original, it's not perfect but it's a fun - if gory - superhero fantasy adventure (or maybe super-villain). The developers went with a more traditional method of storytelling (although they did go a bit heavy on the cut-scenes. but fortunately they are all skippable) and by the last third of the game the adventure does become somewhat repetitive. But the powers are still great and the controls have been streamlined since the original iteration, so it's even easier to become a weapon of mass devastation.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												I strongly suggest not purchasing Prototype 2. Yes, it was fun. Yes, it was marginally well-designed. But over-all, the first one was much, much better. I'll explain why, and you can decide for yourself if my issues are overriding factors for you:1. GraphicsPrototype 2 wins. I'll give it that. It's gorgeous. Poorly optimised, so you're gonna get a crap framerate, but it's gorgeous.2. Control schemePrototype 1 takes the gold there. P1's controls are well-mapped by default and make sense once you become aquainted with them. P2 changes some core controls for no reason, and because of the way they're set up, rebinding them will not help.3. Movement and parkour systemsP1 wins, but mostly because of the control setup. It just flows better, not only because it's been designed better, but also because the controls don't appear to have been designed for a race of crab people.4. GameplayP1 and P2 are actually somewhat tied gameplay-wise. P1's open-world is far more enjoyable and feels more "alive." Things do NOT despawn. I don't mean like they don't despawn for a long time, I mean they DO NOT. I once, to test it, hijacked a helicopter and left it on a roof down on the south end of the map. I then spent an hour or so screwing around in the north end of the map. I then returned and found my chopper in the exact state I had left it, ready for me to board. NPCs react semi-realistically. Civillians will run in fear and panic if they see you changing state, military personell can be fooled enjoyably with shape-shifting, and overall the NPC life feels "alive."P2 wins in events and missions. P1 ultimately has the story missions and that's it. There are side-missions but they're boring as hell and are repetitive, with no real incentive to play them. Granted, it makes up for it by having an enjoyable open-world to explore, but it fails to encourage playing the events. P2, however, has better mission design, even if it does get a little repetitive, and incentive is given in the form of power upgrades to play through the side-missions. Things despawn BADLY. I found two NPCs sitting on some chairs and rotated the camera. When it was turned back, they were completely different races and genders. Vehicles left lying around will disappear as soon as your field of view is broken by buildings.NPCs have slightly better animations but don't react well. Fooling military personell feels like I'm playing hide-and-seek with a babysitter. "Where's the horrifying shapeshifting abominaattiooooonn? I can't fiiiiind hiiiim. Is he heeeere? How about in heeeere?" It just gets old quickly.5. StoryP1's story is far, far superior, and not just because P2 suffers from sequelitis. P1's story is about a man put in confusing circumstances finding out his horrifying past and learning to live with it while being targetted by a shadow mega-corporation that has accidentally caused the destruction of New York. P2's story is about a man finding out his just-for-heart-string-tugging family has been murdered going up against a Saturday morning cartoon villain. To make it worse, P2's main villain is the protagonist of P1, the man you've come to be attached to, and ultimately see as a hero, despite the horrors he's been forced to commit. It feels like a cheap twist placed in for no particular reason other than the writers needing a way to not make you the P1 protagonist again.6. Overall experienceI enjoyed Prototype 2 but only in a very brief sense, about as long as the story lasted, and not for the story, for the missions. While both games offer new-game+ experiences, I just couldn't bring myself to do it with P2. It felt like funding had been cut after the missions had been basically designed, leaving a programmer to write the story and a modeller to design the open-world. Compared to Prototype 1, where I'm currently on new-game+ number four, I just can't recommend Prototype 2. It's fun for a day and that's the end of it, versus fun for as long as you're creative.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												This is ridiculous. What have you done, Activision? Prototype was one of the best sandbox games I've ever played. The controls are awesome, the protagonist was interesting and Alex Mercer was one hell of a killing machine. Never had I experienced such freedom to wreak havoc and the leveling system was enjoyable.Now, Prototype 2 is...  largely inferior to its predecessor, to say the very least. The protagonist is not charismatic at all and dumber than a box of nails. He's a much stereotypical videogame generic badass like only Activision knows how to do. Very bad QTEs and a stupid and extremely invasive tutorial marks the first part of the game. I generally enjoy a quick in-game tutorial, but this is one of the worst I've ever seen. This gets especially ridiculous when the game stops the gameplay to show you something you had to figure out for yourself earlier to advance. I'm not five year old, mind you.The great freedom you had in Prototype is now gone! The map is way smaller, and there is so much less to do. You can't choose your upgrades at will anymore! You have to wait until predetermined ''evolutions'' to add a point to one of a few attributes. And its not a new move, it's just statistics, like adding 10% sprint speed or 20% more damage. It's boring as hell.Also, the character asset design took one hell of a hit. The texture quality of Heller and other NPC/PC is just dreadful, especially when you compare it to the otherwise well textured and lighted environment. I believe it's even worst than the first game.The animation, to my surprise, is not very good either. The animation of vehicles during in-engine cutscenes is robotic, in a way similar to early 2000 games. I don't understand why the developper could not fix this.Now, the technical problems... This will be a deal breaker for many people. This game is just terribly optimized. There is a HUGE memory leak problem that was never (and will never without a doubt) be fixed. This appear to be related to ATI graphics cards. I have a rather solid rig which can run pretty much anything right now at max settings and at a 1680x1050 resolution. I possess 8Gb of RAM + 2GB GRAM. The game can run for approx 30 minutes before the leak occupies all the allocated RAM and starts to lag horribly. This time interval may be smaller if you have a smaller amount of RAM or your system is less powerful. The solution is to alt-tab out of the game when this happen and then go back. The leak will still continue and therefore, you are stuck doing this every 30 minutes or so.This is not a good game. It have many fragments of awesome, but the problems are just so many and so hard to get around that it just outweights its qualities. It's still Prototype though and you'll still have fun wreaking havoc around NYC (NYZ), but if that's all you wanted, go play the first. It got more moves and is funnier overall to play, while the graphics are sufficient to appreciate gameplay at this day.I don't know what you did to Radical during development, Activision, but you killed them, and you killed Prototype.I hate you for what you are doing to the gaming industry.That's all I have to say.

Posted: December 29, 2013
												I LOVE this game and played it four times over on the console, but the PC version is broken. There's a terrible memory leak problem that can cause every machine besides the most beastly of them (think more than 8 gigs of RAM) to have framerates in the 30s or lower from 60+ in a matter of minutes, and if you check your task manager, you can see the game is skyrocketing with RAM use as compared to most games. Now, you can make it go away by doing all sorts of PC gaming tricks, but mostly you will have to minimize and then re-open the game every few minutes. This is unacceptable for any game. Activision also does not support this game, if you try to get help from them then tell them that your desktop is custom built, they will simply tell you they do not support custom builds or laptops and hang up the phone. If you lie and say you have a pre-built machine (like Alienware) then they will tell you they're going to escalate the issue, but never get back to you.Honestly, unless you have a TON of RAM or don't mind constantly minimizing/re-opening the game or changing the graphics options every few minutes, then I say buy it, it's one of the best sequels I've ever played in my life that improves upon the original in every way I can think of. If not for its bad PC port status, I would give this game a glowing review, but as it stands, I can't stand to play any more of it on PC with these glaring issues that will never be fixed because Activision only cares about their money-printing games.EDIT: Works fine on my Windows 8 and Windows 8.1 laptopSpecs:MSI GT70Core i7 4700MQNvidia GeForce GTX 770m 3gb12 gb RAMRunning on a 7200 RPM HDD40+ FPS on max settings 1920x1080 with low anti-aliasing

content:
Posted: August 4, 2015
												Absolutely fantastic game.  Playing on intel/nvidia, have had absolutely zero problems.As to the gameplay itself, it kind of feels like I'm playing an amoral amalgamation of a bunch of the Marvel superheroes.  I've got the claws of Wolverine, the ability to knock people around like Magneto, the ability to shapeshift like Mystique, plus a variety of other things.Just running around the city is a freaking joy, to be honest.  You run straight up buildings, glide through the air, jump crazy distances, pounce on enemies or poor random citizens as you please, etc.  It feels like Spiderman without any sort of web-swinging restrictions, or Batman without any sort of grappling restrictions.To be clear, it's not a superhero game -- but it sure does feel more like one than any game I've played that actually features superheroes.  Then again, I'd classify the main character as "mostly a villain, despite doing things that help the greater good."  My guy isn't concerned with saving random citizens from battles that break out; he actually freaking EATS them to regain health.  Or to shapeshift into their form and escape detection.Basically nobody in this game is a good person at all, and I don't particularly have a problem with that.  Even the random citizens seem to be rude at best.Ultimately this boils down to a power-trip sort of game, with a good amount of challenge despite always making you feel incredibly badass.  That's hard to pull off, but this is done super well.Verdict: I would buy a sequel, no questions.  This game is absolutely worth full price.

Posted: September 26, 2013
												At first I thought this game was broken... Once I fixed the lag issue I found that this is one of the most enjoyable third-person sandbox games for casual play, when I'm in the mood to lounge on the couch with a game pad, I turn on Steam's Big Picture Mode, launch the game and massacre the city for hours. The Radnet DLC add hours of challenges to beat friends high-scores.Many ATI Radeon users have experienced a memory leak that has made Prototype 2 unplayable. This fix seems to eradicate the issue and locks the client at 30fps, almost perfectly stable.1. Run Prototype 2 and disable Anti-Aliasing in the game client2. Download and install Radeon Pro Preview http://www.radeonpro.info/download/a. Create a profile for Prototype2.exe by searching in steamapps/common/prototype2b. On the "Tweaks" tab:VSync control : Always on (Double VSync)Dynamic Framerate C Keep up to : 30 FPS Maxc. On the "Advanced" tab:Flip Queue Size = 1 (Set to 1 and Check to Enable)3. Right click on the profile your created in RadeonPro and click "Apply Now"4. Ensure RadeonPro is running and start the game normally.5. Play the game and enjoy!

content:
Posted: May 7, 2014
												Prototype 2 is not perfect and there are a few things which need to do a better job next game - like the lack of variation in missions - , but nonetheless this is one of the most visceral, spectacular and brutal sandboxes out there. Like a lot of action games, the story needs a bit of work, but if you can overcome it's minor short comings, this game can be a whole lot of fun.You may have a few hiccups here and there, but there's plenty to do in Prototype 2. More times than not, you'll have a blast doing all of it.Prototype 2 is a decent open-world action game, that does not invent the wheel, but it does manage to offer solid amounts of entertainment, splattered with generous servings of blood and mayhem.My only real concern is that this PC version is very conservative in comparison with the console version, with minimal graphical improvements and imprecise mouse+keyboard controls.The three month delay could have been used to make the most of the PC capabilities in my opinion. A rather poor treatment for the PC gamers.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2015
												Taking place a year after the events in the first Prototype, Prototype 2 is gritty, bloody story about revenge. You play as James Heller, a soldier in the military, freshly made infected by the main character of the last game, Alex Mercer. He has given you the power to get revenge for your wife and daughter, who died because of what is known as the Mercer Virus, supposedly released by Blackwatch (the acting military force in the New York (or what's left of it). As the game progresses, while the missions you do may change, revenge remains your motive, and anything that stands in your way will be killed, blown up, or consumed. I love the gameplay of Prototype 2. While it can get repetitive after too long, the effect of your attacks is oh so satisfying. Smash, cut, slice, dice, tear apart, and consume anyone that gets in your way, civilians and soldiers alike. Later in the game you can even drive tanks and fly in helicopters. There are 3 parts of the map that you unlock progressively through out the game, but I felt they did a good job with how long it takes you to unlock them. The story line isn't the greatest, until you get 2/3 into the game. The voice acting of the guy who played James Heller is amazing, and definitely gets you immersed in his character. This is definitely one of my favorite games of all time. It's the definition of "a bloody good time".9/10 for me.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												A friend helped me laying my hands on this during the summer sale so Credits to Bram first! <3So here it is - my review for 'Prototype 2' on Steam. If you are interested in my opinion of the Original 'Prototype' game you can find the review here: http://steamcommunity.com/id/IvanDankov/recommended/10150/ So this time it's yet again your turn to stop "Blackwatch" and the infection going on in "NYZ" but this time you are playing the role of the ex-military 'James Heller'. His team had an operation in ''NYZ'' but got killed when they encountered the main antagonist of the game: 'Alex Mercer'. -Unlike his goal in Prototype 1 he now wants to take over the City and kind of re-populate with evolved made by him with similar abilities . As the only survivor of his attack.. he infectes you with the "Mercer Virus" and now the game begins. We discover that it was Mercer killing his wife and daughter with his "second outbreak" of the mercer virus (first outbreak would be the one of 'Prototype 1') and now crave for revenge and make him suffer as we did. During all this yet again alot of twists will come up and in the end you find yourself chasing after something way more important than 'Alex Mercer' himself.. Thats it from me about the story since I dont like revealing too much for potential buyers. The gameplay stays more or less the same as in one with further improvements and a combat system to die for.Its too much fun running, flying, slashing ,beating or body surfing your way through the City with an endless amout of ways to kill people, new monsters and tons of side missions that can keep you busy for a good while. I even recommend buying the DLC "RADNET Access Pack" if it's on sale since it adds new activities and a ranking system for you and your friends that unlocks rewards and Skins for 'Heller' if you complete them. The achievments are again just fun to attempt with good challenges and references to movies or other games.The graphics though are a mixed bag to me...some of the textures just look like they are from 2002 while animations and especially 'Hellers' different forms look very detailed and cool. But overall they are perfect fitting for a game like that and I am sure it won't stand in your way. Again I was using an Nvidia Graphics Card and haven't encountered any technical issues with that game on highest settings but I am aware that 'AMD' cards are horribly optimized in this game so I'd recommend to get it on console ('AMD' users) if you have one. On sale both (Game + DLC) cost me ~ 10 bucks and I dare to say that its a good invenstment since you can spend a good amount of hours in this game trying to complete it 100%. If you just care about the Story (wich may not be the most interesting for everyone) you can leave the DLC behind and finish the main Story in about 10 hours then quit and have another game on your "Story-Completed-List". Overall I can say that if you loved the first one you will cheat on it with PROTOTYPE 2. Gameplay feels more satisfying than in any other third person game (with hack 'n slay elements ofc) and the over the top gore is just great. I highly recommend yet another game of my list that I used to love back in 2012 / 2013 and now got it again on steam.As always I hope that my review was good / helpful and you might have found something interesting for yourself.Have a good day! :D

content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												Prototype 2 is the perfect example of how to create a sequel that somehow manages to less than the game that precedes it. While it maintains much of the same gameplay of the original everything has been cut down in size and scope. Smaller world, less enemies, less powers, less weapons, less vehicles, less moves, shorter storyline. Even the graphics are not as impressive. You could switch the numbers at the end of the two Prototype games and it would be more logical.The combat is still great fun but with less enemies and less types of enemies fighting them becomes very predictable very quickly and with less powers, weapons and moves at your disposal you have very little option for mixing it up.The movement scheme with the parkour and infected powers is still one of the greatest open world movement systems around but because New York City has been downsized quite severely and now exists in small zones you can't really take advantage of the movement the same way you could in the original.Perhaps the biggest clue that this wasn't going to be an equal to the original comes in the form of the storyline and the character development. Instead of the mysterious and morally conflicted protagonist of the original Prototype 2 casts you as a random jar-head out for revenge but quickly goes on a mission to save the world in an all too predictable way. The storyline of Prototype was obviously concocted by someone that have never bothered to play the original, almost all of the major plot-points and revelations of the original are either ignored or contradicted directly. All the shades of morality have been sucked out of the game and instead of the morally ambiguous characters and grey story of the original we get a predictable story about a angelically inclined hero versus a bunch of bad guys that are portrayed like Joseph Mengeler's meaner older brother.Don't bother with this game, the original was a great play and I still heartily recommend it but the sequel is simply not worth the bother.

												Definitely a love.I've never made myself to complete a game fully in months. But i had to play this one just to know how the story ends. And I'm pretty amazed.Story is very interesting when you pass the 30% of it but its also very short and you can complete it in 5 or 6 hours and maybe less if you ignore all collectibles and any side missions and achievements.Graphics are also very much improvement against first game. Game also has many performance issues that never been patched. But they very much dodged me. I don't have AMD so i only turn of Raptr to play the game.Gameplay is pretty much the same as first game. You can destroy everything with mashing a button and even destroy trees cuz we all know that trees in games are usually gods. You again can use abilities and run like a Flash, fly, scale buildings only using your legs and jump 5 meters high... Also u can fight zombies and mutants.. And an army... Fun...I would definitely recommend the game if you know how to dodge the performance issues.Cheers.

content:
Posted: January 15
												-Just as rich as part 1-There is no humour here, game is a grim-dark open world game about the player being a living bio-weapon.You run up buildings, glide above the city, absorb humans to regain health and wear their face.You throw cars at choppers and slay soldiers with your viral tendrils.The game values your time and is fast action without being to long or inserting artificial lengtheners. Collectibles give you new powers and aren't useless like in other games. The story about revenge and conspiracy is forgettable, this is meant as a power trip.I had no technical problems playing the game with my gear (Nvidia card, Windows 10).As a German: get the game key from Humble store to circumvent the authoritarian censorship.Hope someone picks up on the IP of being some superpowered anti-hero virus weapon in the future, formula felt quite unique.

number of helpful: 28 of 40 people (70%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												Prototype 2 was an alright game. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't that great. Some new additions, skills and abilities from the first game, but not much change other then the advancement of story line.The story line takes place after Alex Mercer has released the virus and begun infecting New York City. He has become corrupt with power and seeks destruction. It almost seems generic as the first game, but still quite playable. I did enjoy it, as much as I could, but probably not as much as I did with the first Prototype. The story line did play out pretty well, but they could have done a much better job with this epidemic.The combat system was alright as well. It had some new additions and skills to go with it, but like I mentioned before, not many. The combat is very gory. Much to be expected from a game of infection. The input of the combat didn't differ much from the first Prototype. I also think they could've done more with this as well. It's always from to drop from 1000ft to Ground Zero and devour someone for their health and identity. Always useful when trying to escape from the armed forces.A lot of work and changes should have been made before release. I would recommend getting this on special if you are at all interested in this game. It's still a good game, just not a great game. I completed it in under 20 hours.3/5

content:
Posted: April 28, 2016
												I don't understand why more people didn't play this game when it was released. This is one of my favourite games, it's fun, immersive and well designed. There are some technical problems with it now and it is a shame that the PC port isn't better.I read today that there is a Biohazard collection available on PS4 and Xbone with both this, the first game and the DLC included. GameSpot reviewed it and just criticised how it's a bad port on those systems as well. They didn't mention any of the games strenghts which is normal actualy when it comes to the Prototype series but a big shame in my opinion.With a few tweaks here on PC the game is running pretty good for me. However there are still some frame drops and some stuttering but this decreases in the later areas. It's a shame that I can't experience it with better performance but it's still an amazing game. Which I am enjoying alot regardless of these issues.It's packed with interesting content, immersive menu screens, good sound design and a great athmosphere throughout.I put a SweetFx profile on it too and it looks pretty good. It's just a shame nobody has modded in a HD remaster yet like they did with Remember Me for example.Anyway, I highly recommend you buy and play this game, especially if it's on sale.Grab the Radnet DLC too for more cool content.Even with it's technical problems the game can still be enjoyed and is definitely worth playing.I googled some fixes before I started and I'm having a blast with it now.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
 PROTOTYPE 2 This is one of the games that YOU should play if you are STRESSED. You are an overpowered being with lots of powers. You can consume people to get life and memories. You can fly around the city and run incredibly fast. You can use people as BIOBOMBS. You can ELIMINATE a whole army without even getting a single scratch. Pros  Cool, Overpowered passive abilities New Bigger Map, NYZ It is much easier to use the powers for you can use 2 of them without changing it in the weapon wheel New Powers, most of the powers in the game replaced the other powers in the first game New Jumping System ( Others would take this as a con ) An improvement over the first one, Stealth Consume, Weapons, Graphics (Obviously), Combat, etc. Cons  There is a bug in the mission,  specifically "Operation Flytrap" , where after some time you cannot continue after doing the  Claw Pounce Attack to the Blackwatch Soldier  unless if you go the settings of the game in the task manager and change how many processors are running it. The bug doesn't appear in every computer though. WHY IS ALEX MERCER THE ANTAGONIST OF THE GAME?EDIT: Nevermind I just read the comics This is not much of a con for me but there are a lot of Removed Powers and Moves (R.I.P. Muscle Mass and Armor). Most of them are useless anyways Neutral To be honest, the story and characters were fine. MY RATING 9.5 / 10Would use people as BIOBOMBS again

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
												As other users have pointed out, IF YOU HAVE AN AMD CARD, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS GAME! I had an older AMD card (HD 6670) and it played it "fine" except that after like 10 mintues it got slower and slower, especially after in game cutscenes like picking up black boxes. The reason why I said "fine" was because when you alt+tabbed out and back in, the game ran properly again. This led to me having to alt+tab every 10 mintues or so just to have a good playing experience. Then, one day, I wanted to play and the game ran like absolute garbage. You would think I was trying to do a real time simulation of the universe on my computer from how slow it was. I'm talking literally 0-3 fps with occasional jumps to 6-13. Even after I got a much better AMD card (R9 380 nitro), the game ran exactly the same, 0-3 fps on a card that can run GTA V and Witcher 3 at 30 fps on max settings. The devs didn't just drop the ball, they hit AMD users in the face with it. I am just glad I got about 60 hours out of this game before it went to the lowest circle of hell.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												This isn't a bad game. It's not a great game either, but I found it surprisingly enjoyable, even though I didn't really like the first game. While the first game had fun (if a bit unpolished) gameplay, it lacked heavily in it's story and characters. This game on the other hand, has a much better story and characters, but the developers attempted to streamline the combat and powers, which causes the gameplay to be a bit of a step back.Pros:-Fun gameplay-Much better story and characters than in the first game-Plenty of side-missions and collectiblesCons:-Not much variation in combat, especially compared to the first game-Graphics seem a bit unpolished for a 2012 game-Fighting multiple strong enemies at the same time can be frustrating-Relatively short main story content (less than 8 hours on Normal)While I do have more cons than pros listed, I would say that the enjoyment I've gotten out of the game jusitifies the purchase, and I would recommend picking it up, especially if you enjoyed the first game.That said, definitely buy it on sale. As enjoyable as the game is, the base price of $40 is a bit expensive for the amount of content you're getting.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												When I saw what rating this game has, I was stunned.  I've played through from start to finish three times and am now starting my fourth.  There's an incredible amount of replayability with NG+, all of the radnet challenges and tonnes of collectibles.I found the combat to be very impactful and the unlocks are quite well paced.  Loads of skins and bonus toys (cheats, basically) are around for those who have beaten the game.  There are (what feels like) hours of backstory cutscenes done with real people in a weird ultra edited kind of style that are a blast to watch, too.My complaints would be that James Heller and Alex Mercer are both a bit bland and the story from the direct perspective of the player has a way to go to be truly immersive and believable (the backstory scenes tell the story very well, but these are optional and a lot is left out during the main course of the game).  The combat is what completely makes up for it, for me.  In fact, the Prototype games are side-by-side my favourite games of all time.DISCLAIMER: It looks like a lot of people are having trouble with AMD cards.  If you have one, take care when purchasing this game.  I haven't had any trouble with this game on my GTX 960.

number of helpful: 13 of 20 people (65%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
												I liked the first Prototype. The combat and movement mechanics were fantastic, while the world felt full of life. It had an uncanny sense of complete chaos, like as it was hard to see the difference between civilians and zombies in the crowds. The second game builds on the world design from the first game and creates an even more believable sense of bewildering chaos. It’s so much that it’s hard to take in if you just stand and look at it all. Any ideas you might have of avoiding collateral damage quickly go out the window. You just can’t help killing crowds of innocents when dealing with the military or monsters in the city. The city is just too dense for combat.Prototype 2 is a wasted opportunity. The world design is the perfect stage for any post-apocalyptic game. It’s teeming with details and history. The art department really went all out in creating a believable world. Even the sound design is impressive. It’s subtle, and has a carefully designed wide dynamic range. It’s full of details, like car tires squealing when an NPC slams the brakes to avoid hitting you. It’s a competent studio pulling out some of the best work of the generation. And it’s all ruined by the story.I don’t know what they were thinking when they signed off on the script. Did someone high up decide that this was fine, because “it’s just a game”? The story and characters are about as shallow as they get. Nobody has anything resembling a personality or a story arc through the game. They all look different, but the way they speak, their motivations and their roles in the story is all devoid of texture or depth. It’s just flat and boring, and as a result you can’t get engaged in anything going on. The mechanics are all great, and the mission designs are acceptably good. But there’s no excitement to see what happens next. Despite the abysmal story and characters I still had a good time playing the game, thanks to everything else being good. But make no mistake, this game is instantly forgettable. You barely know what’s going on even as it’s happening, because it’s all flat and monotone. It’s like going on a nice sightseeing trip through a nightmare vision of New York. But we’ve already seen plenty of those, so that might not have much novelty value. I wanted to play the game after playing Saints Row 4, because SR4 basically copy-pasted the game mechanics of Prototype. For the €5 I paid Prototype 2 was worth it, but I can’t get over what a wasted opportunity this was. Every other component is here for a phenomenal game, but they decided that players don’t care about story and that this level of ambition is fine. And it just isn’t.

												I love this game, the campaign was around 11-12 hours on normal difficulty; so if it's on sale it's definatly worth a purchase. It does have a couple of problems however. Firstly it is quite graphicly intensive, i have a decent PC that can play games like battlefield 4 on high/ultra settings and get 70-80 fps; however on this game with medium settings i only get around 60-70 fps 'SO BE AWARE'Secondly it has a very bad issue with memory usage. For me, after about an hour playing, it starts to get really laggy & unplayable; which normally results in me having to restart the game (which is annoying if your in the middle of a mission)Thirdly the game sometimes randomly CTD's without any warning, normally for me after around 2-4 hours playing.Finally for me everytime I use the 'pack leader ability' my screen freezes, the game is still playing in the background as you can hear the audio and still target things, however you can't see your character just the frozen moment when you used the ability (this hinders the game as a couple of times during the story as you have to use the ability to complete missions)Apart from these things, I have noticed a couple of glitches with wall running, stealth consumes and AI; but overall i would highly recommend this game.IF IT IS ON OFFER GRAB IT!EDIT: Since I upgraded some of my hardware the game either refuses to boot, or runs at around 3 FPS even with everything on low. So take care when choosing to buy this game or not.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2016
												Become A Ultimate Shape-Shifting Weapon Taking place a year after the events in the first Prototype, Prototype 2 is gritty, bloody story about revenge. You play as James Heller, a soldier in the military, freshly made infected by the main character of the last game, Alex Mercer. He has given you the power to get revenge for your wife and daughter, who died because of what is known as the Mercer Virus, supposedly released by Blackwatch (the acting military force in the New York (or what's left of it). As the game progresses, while the missions you do may change, revenge remains your motive, and anything that stands in your way will be killed, blown up, or consumed. 9,9/10 Will like it

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												Alright so, apperently half of negative reviews are because the fps lag and something about AMD not working well with this? Well bs, there is a solution on internet for this - just google it... it's how I fixed my problems (yes I am AMD user) and I had clean fps ever since. **What worked for me is I changed CatalystAI key value to 30 and CatalystAI_DEF key value to 0**As for the game itself:-graphics: beautiful graphic and effects >> 9/10-gameplay: I liked the movement way more than the first game, and lots of people say that Prototype 1 had more and better stuff, well, I agree and disagree, but imo, gameplay is fantastic and I had fun every second of it >> 9/10-story: yeah, as others may already have said, it's not as good as Prototype 1 buuut ehh it's fine I guess, Heller's jokes crack me up tho >> 7/10Overall thoughts: I liked the game from the start, and I think it's one of most fun games I've played - cus of free roam and killing; some people are desperate with the ending, but I liked the ending (it's my personal opinion that I actually rooted for Heller to win over Mercer); and I believe this game is so underrated >> 8/10

content:
Posted: January 21
												This game is a big improvement from the first Prototype.  The story flows better, the graphics are better, and the combat improved.If you played Prototype, this game will continue that story.  However playing P1 is not necessary and I would actually just skip it and watch a video of the story element or just watch the summary of P1 that is included in P2’s main menu.From the very beginning, your abilities quickly grow to feeling much more powerful than you ever were in the first game.  I can’t tell you how awesome it was to use Tendrils to so quickly and easily bring down red alert helicopters chasing me.Combat has been improved by adding dodge and counter options helping to make you really outclass your opponents and escape hunter/brawlers “juggling” hits.There are still some repetitious side quests, but the story around them helps keep things interesting.  This may have led to the feeling that experience was a lot easier to come across.  It was never very long before I had obtained another upgrade.Rating – 8/10

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												Prototye 2 is a game that allows you to destroy a world with a variety of powers and abilities.  The powers are by far the strong point of the game becuase it keeps the combat from becoming bland and repetitive.  Other than that the story is over the top in the best way possible and the writing is filled with many ridiculous one liners.  the game does suffer from some problems like the lack of content after the game.  Once you have finnished the main story you would exspect a variety of side quests and missions.  You will be dissapointed to find that there is little to nothing to do other than lair takovers that only grant you a mini boss and some extra exspirience.  The game also has little replayability becuase the story is so linear and you obtain every power in every game you play you will find little reason to play the game again.  That being said I enjoyed the time I did spend during the 9+ hour main story so I have to give credit where its do.  7.5/10

content:
Posted: December 12, 2015
												Prototype 2 is a good sequel of the first game, with improved graphics and gameplay.The difficulty of the sequel seems to be somewhat lower, the Insane difficulty being locked until you clear the game for the first time.The animations can sometimes be choppy, most of the combos locking you down and preventing you from moving in any other direction but forward. Also, the verticality provided by the tall buildings is only enjoyable in parkour, with only 1 attack per weapon that targets airborne enemies or structures, the other ones just sending you like a comet towards the ground.The graphics are okay for 2015, some of the ground / wall textures being low quality. Also, props like AC units, cars or other things you can throw are simple and look decent.The pacing of the game tends to be fast, although the player can approach enemies in multiple ways, even with ranged attacks and military weapons. If you are playing close-range melee, chances are you won't even notice the low-quality textures or the dumb civilian AI...The story is...compelling at most. I've completed the main story + all //BLACKNET sidequests (each one has 2-3 missions) in about 20 hours.The soundtrack is nothing special, SFX being fair and the  voice acting being on the bright side.As conclusion, here are my ratings for the game:7.5 / 10  Graphics7 / 10     Animations7 / 10     Audio (OST + SFX)7 / 10     Story8 / 10     GameplayOverall: 7.3 / 10

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												A very good action game. I liked it enough to get all of the achievements. I think it plays better than the original prototype, though it kind of kills the personality of the main character from the first game. You play as a soldier who gets infected with a disease that has been producing horrific monsters all over the city. You start with a few mutations, I think you get claws first, and you get more stuff as you level up like hammer fists, a whip fist, and tentacles. I would say about 50% of the powers and stuff from the original game return, the rest is new. It also replaces those stupid orbs with blackbox collection and scientist elimination, which is much more interesting. I would say it is an improvement on the original game, except for the fact that it makes Alex Mercer look super lame.I am aware of a bug that causes the game to be unplayable with a mouse and keyboard, but I have played the game on three different computers with a mouse and keyboard setup and had no problems.Graphics are pretty mediocer. Music can be good at times, but for the most part it's pretty forggetable. The story is pretty basic, but it does the job. I would generally recommend this game, it is pretty decent all around and it isn't too specifically designed in it's appeal.7/10 would use a random civilian to bio-bomb a paniced mass of civilians again.

number of helpful: 25 of 45 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												All the little touches that made the original so great are missing. In Prototype 1 beating on a zombie was like an elegant dance that you had full control over how it was executed. The combat system in Prototype 2 was chopped to pieces and sewn back together from Prototype 1 all in the name of letting you use two abilities at once. But those abilities only have half the options in the name of making you able to hot-swap them faster. You also only get one new main power different from Prototype 1. I CANNOT RECCOMEND PROTOTYYPE 1 ENOUGH but 2 is an unworthy successor. The commercial got me all jazzed and the game let me down.

												Game crashes on startup, turns out it's an incredibly common problem.  The "fix" is to unplug all of your usb devices except the mouse and then start the game up.  However, in my case, the game did not detect my mouse or my keyboard after getting past the main menu and into a new game.  So I could only move the camera and attack.  There's no mod support, and all potential links for a fix I found on various forms are dead.  X360ce also does not alleviate the problem.  This product really should not be able to be purchased, it's a broken game.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												Prototype is one of those few games nowadays that remember to be fun. You have the option to eat an old lady, steal her identity and use it to butcher countless hordes of innocent civilians/incredibly evil mercenaries. Any game in which you can sprout swords from your very own spaghetti flesh deserves a reccomendation in my book.You start off in the least screwed up area where it sets the stage to show you just how cartoonishly evil Blackwatch are (see slaughtering autistic child for no discernible reason). It also allows you to hone your wallrunning old lady killing Blackwatch disgruntling skills. The game truly does deliver a sense of just how powerful you are when you can run up walls and obliterate anyone who so much as comments on your spaghetti appearance in a hurtful manner.While overall I like the story and it does throw some curveballs your way it gives you no real reason to care about any of the characters (at least not until 3 quarters of the story in that is) for any reason other than "CAUSE HELLER LIKES HIM!" or "WHO CARES IF THAT PERSON IS LESS TRUSTWORTHY THAN A BLOODSTAINED PERSON IN A HOCKEY MASK BREAKING INTO YOUR HOUSE WHILST TELLING YOU HOW TO INCREASE YOUR MANHOOD".Moreover it is very difficult to make Heller seem like a good person when you're just gonna murder ten families as soon as the cutscene ends, which is odd because the game does try to do so. It fails horribly.....but it does try. "My family is dead!" is not a good defence for murdering half the human bloody population! *Minor spoiler alert* it becomes a bit ludicrous at a point where he is about to kill someone and then at the last moment he realises that the target has children so he decides against it...I'm sorry what! Does the Mercer virus make you as thick as a vault door or something? Even if you only count the kills mandated by the story then there surely must be millions of bereft families by that point. It's a bit bloody late to start caring now.Despite it's flaws it is a genuinely fun game and I would reccomend it to someone wanting either a fun sandbox game or a surprise-a-bunch-of-soldiers-that-you're-their-friend-and-then-punch-them-so-hard-they-cough-up-your-wedding-ring simulator.

content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												THIS IS HOW OPEN WORLD GAMES WITH DESTRUCTION SHOULD BE ! Probably you are like wtf ? This game is absolutly sick , if you love destruction and just wrecking everything ,then this game is definitly for you ! You play as a Soldier and get infected after that ..... Everything becomes different.You become an absolutly bloody , amazing killer with so many destruction options.If you got Radnet Dlc You can fire Laser and blow up tanks and more.You like to play with tanks ? Go ahead !Hijack one and blow the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of them !You want to fly with a helicopter ? Do it ! And terrorize the town or wreck the infection.Your abilities are also pretty sick.Tendrils,Claws,Sword,Whipe and Hammerfist.Also you can consume and copy everyones look.So no one will ever know , who you are.Sometimes it's required for some missions or just to start a pretty sick ambush attack or making hijacking a bit easier ,if you prefer it like that.Radnet Dlc add some more options like Laser beams shooted by your eyes or destroy stuff ,while you push yourself off from the ground and creating shockwaves or smashing down on the ground and more sick stuff.You will notice you are pretty overpowered and this games makes you feel like a badass."Nothing can stop you!",thats what the Devs did pretty well in this game,even if you play it on insane .You are still overpowered as ♥♥♥♥.Also its kinda interesting just to walk around as a soldier or as a civil person and take a look ,how peoples react on you.It's cool and really sick.Or look and listen to the peoples reactions or what they talk about.For me its a feeling , that i rarely get in some other games.Also the feeling you get in some Zones is kinda amazing.What i really like is how they created those "Zones" .I'm talking about the "Red Zone","Yellow Zone" And "Green Zone".The Red zone is overrunned by infected and is a war between Soldiers and Infected,while some Survivors try to stay alive,which you see sometimes flee from the Infected.The Yellow zone is a military zone ,where peoples are may infected or not.Also there are alot of Scanners and Scandrones seeking for infected.It`s really nice and well made to see those "Villages" build by metals and seeing the Soldier patrolling around.I really like it.The Green zone is the "Non infected zone".Here are n Infected or well almost.It`s pretty sick to see the peoples how they enjoy their life and feeling in safety , until you send them to hell...Of course there is a downside in this game.First: is that the Zones feels kinda small .Well they are not soo tiny , but they could be more bigger.Second: some Players have some issues with starting or playing the game sadly.Third: you will notice some glitches like peoples looking up to the sky ,while running away.It`s hiliarous and some more bugs,but no bugs , that i think is "gamebreaking"Fourth: It lacks a bit "Variations" , if you played Prototype 1 , then you know what i mean.There could be more abilities and more destruction stuff.This game and those Devs is/made such an amazing game , if you seek for destruction and explosion,then go buy it!Seriously!I wish there would be another Prototype 3 , but sadly the Company got all fired -____-.Atleast it's a rumor.Still the game is amazing and still in my eyes one of the best games ,which got ever created.Those Devs today should try to create a game similiar to this.It's amazing and sick !Also the feeling in all those Zones or the Sound .It's stunning for me.And of course the Radnet Dlc offers you some Skin varations + some mods aswell.I highly recommend this game and hope that there will be a Prototype 3 , a mix between Prototype 1 and 2 !

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												This is the sort of game I play to pass the time. It's worth getting if you're a fan of single player campaign missions or a fan of mauling any being you come into contact with. The cutscene styles are amazing, giving you access to limited colours that mainly consist of red, and the occasional blue from a computer screen (not blue screen of death). These cutscenes are very well animated and great to watch. It isn't only those scenes that are greatly satisfying though, when you 'consume' a specific target in the game, you are able to access their memories and previous thoughts or just be able to access the correct information you are looking for. These scenes are also well animated and well thought through, they don't give you a lot of easily noticeable imagery as it skips between images and people and small clips very quickly, but, that also makes it all the better to watch as it is mainly the talking that allows you to breifly understand what is going on in the fast paced images. Furthermore, the gameplay is relatively smooth, but it moves around and sends you of course more often than I had hoped, I have played the console version of this game and I would have to say that it was not much different to this one really, just, the controls are a lot easier to understand as there are a lot less buttons to press and hold. So, I would encourage you to use a controller rather than the keyboard. Overall, the rating of this game would be 7/10. If you found this helpful. You're welcome.

												Much like The Force Unleashed 2 this is vastly superior to it's predecessor and is yet considered to be the inferior one. I don't know how this happens, perhaps it's just "this one came first syndrome". Point being almost every flaw or problem I had with the first one is solved in this one. Again, just like TFU2 I played through and enjoyed the first way back on the 360 and never got a chance to play their sequels until very recently. Maybe I'm just less patient with older games that don't qulaify as retro yet but I found the firsts of both games to be kinda... meh. Like, they just didn't age well and this one still feels kinda- well 'fresh' is pushing it but you know what I mean.The story's cool, the way they turned the protagonist of the first into the antagonist was dope. They've done away with the whole "web" thing and just given side missions from a military terminal which involves hunting a dude, doing a mission and consuming some guys organs and memories. The combat is a little tighter and generally better looking than the first, the controls and movement are all improved and there is a great line involving skull♥♥♥♥ing. Also I played this on Windows 10 on max settings, 60fps without a hitch and my GPU is a 670. While that doesn't guarantee it'll run perfectly for everyone I've seen a few reviews mentioning bad performance as a core negative aspect so I thought I'd mention it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												I played the first Prototype (and enjoyed it) on the PS3 few years back. I thought the first game was good for the time and was hoping for a second one to be released. When I saw the advertisement for the Prototype2  I just had no reaction to it and decided to add this title to my maybe pile for the future. So when it came up on steam deals I toke a chance and got it. The game is very similar to the original in both good and bad ways, The combat feels the same which if you didn't like the first game then you won't like this. The story is mediocre at best (compared to modern standards) with no real connection with the main character, which could leave most people possibly disinterested on following the game till the end. However James Heller is a badass character himself and they could of created a much better back story for him. This may seem like I'm ripping on the game but, it falls down at most of the points it needs to hit. There are some features of the game which are original and with work (possibly in a Third Prototype game) they would have chance to shine. All in all if you liked the first one then pick this up (on a deal of course).

Posted: May 24, 2014
												Besides the fact of the major bugs and lack of support in this game i can say that it is a very fun game it is rather short of a game but it happened to take me 13 hours to finish it for the small fact that i like to goof around and♥♥♥♥♥♥ I love the true sandbox feel of this game although its not up to calliber to grand theft auto it is still a very great game. There is two major bugs that i couldnt seem to fix through the game...one was the dioalouge and most sound was completely absent when i played on my headphones but if i set the volume to go through my tv it was fine... i tried all those techniques of changing the Hz to 44000 and 16 bit and all that and it still refused to work...another bug was that after about 20 minutes of gameplay the game would exponentially lag  and stutter around unil finally it got into single digit fps and i couldnt take it anymore and saved and quit but once i restarted the game it would go back to 60 fps fine until about another 20 min... one thing i found out a little bit later was that if i would hit the windows key and get out of the game for a second then go back in that it would be less likely to lag but i would have to do this periodically about every 5 minutes or so which is quite a nuisence. Besides those two major bugs i can still say that i had a great time playing prototype and i will continue to play just for the sandox part of it :D

												One thing I hate about steam reviews is the fact that people don't recommend this game because of their technical problems. I feel like Steam should do something about this, something like putting a warning on the game's store page about it so an amazing game that has issues running with certain types of hardware doesn't get pushed down to "Mixed" reviews.Anyway, if you can run this game, you'll see from the vast majority of the reviews that you should play it. RIP AMD users.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
												If you can remember it, this is pretty much like the first prototype.Mostly the same mechanics, but a bit more polished. Less challenge missions, and harder to fail them. Pretty much ez-mode all the way through on Normal difficulty (with only a couple of speedbumps along the way) but I honestly wouldn't recommend you play it any other way. It's a power fantasy, through and through, and that's how it plays best.Controls on keyboard & mouse are fine. A bit wonky at times, but you'll get used to them. It's a console port, so a controller is probably better if you got one. No dealbreaker though. I played through it without one easily.There's a few bugs the developers never fixed, but since it's a 4 years old title at this point random folks on the internet has already solved them for you. AMD users (allegedly) needs a registry fix to play, and there's a point in the second mission where you have to alt-tab out and set CPU affinity to just CPU 0 for a few minutes to get past a glitchy trigger-event (the Pounce Claw Attack tutorial). Other than that, I experienced no technical problems at all throughout the rest of the game (running Nvidia and Core I7).Bottom line: It's a non-stop action fest of gore and destruction for 12-14 hours.If you like action games and it's on a sale, it's absolutely worth it.

content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
												As an AMD owner and Win 10 user here is my experience with this game.Short version: Fun as hell, just like the first game. Some bugs and glitches are present but i can tolerate that much.Long version:One key feature is the game has + difficulty setting. For example after completing the game on easy, you gain most of the powers and easy+ difficulty starts the story from the beginning with all the abilities and mutations present. So it restarts the story, not you :) Which is the most brilliant idea of this game.If you know first game and enjoyed it, you will %100 sure definitely like more or less this one too.Just like the first game, map is big enough, movement is fluid and easy, combat is fun and detailed (with less key combinations compared to the first game, so less complicated), you can drive tanks or fly helicopters, story is like the movie "TAKEN" :)Visually fantastic but every 20 minutes or so, the game stucks. Press Alt Tab and get back to game again and it will be corrected. It is not that big of a problem for me. But it can strike in the most exciting moment of the game.Just like the first game, after completing the story (took 8 hours in easy+ difficulty) you can challange your friends in game challanges or just create chaos in the RED ZONE.If you do not mind occasional bugs, this game is fun and diverse. Ultimate destruction and massacre :)

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												PROTOTYPE 2 review, TAKE 2:This may contain spoilers. If you know me personally then keep scrolling.First of all, I got this game because I wanted to see what happened after the prequel, PROTOTYPE. I really loved PROTOTYPE- a lot. It had a decent story, characters, plot and this and that. The gameplay in PROTOTYPE 2 is very similar to that of the prequel (and there's nothing wrong with that). It is nice that you can do a little more while holding someone by the neck or standing on the hatch of a tank. But aside from the pretty graphics and all that, the powers are easier to use and much more flexible to swap, but you have to completely enter and exit a disguise just to hide them rather than just hit a little bind key. And, if you actually played the first game, you may recall those old combat moves that Alex Mercer could use for different combat situations. Those features were completely wiped clean of PROTOTYPE 2's gameplay. Now, here's the story criticism:Remember that movie, Ender's Game? Remember that quote: "In the moment when I truly understand my enemy, understand him well enough to defeat him, then in that very moment I also love him."? Yeah. About that... I think that the creators got just a little too lazy the the plot in this game. They took the Alex Mercer from the prequel and just made him the antagonist. Just suddenly- with no concerns, no looking back... Not many of you would care, but it still left a few gaps in the original story. It's actually pretty funny: "I won't let you erase New York like you erased hope." moments later, you find him killing innocents and blowing up NYC with his bio weaponry. I still find it silly how they brought us this new guy, "Heller", and struck him in a pit with Alex and made them kill each other. Alex was THE start of this series, and not a lot of people know that since they're just buying the "better game". "KILL BAD GUY KILL BAD GUY"Yeah. The story to PROTOTYPE 2 is as simple as it is. Murder your maker. Get revenge.Yawn. Oh, who's Heller again? Nothing interesting at all, as far I can recall. (Since I actually played the first game) I found this game almost even intimidating. The reason I have so many hours on it is because I loaded a complete save and got that silly RADNET access thing so I don't have to deal with being Heller. Dear god... The way he strokes his bald scalp... You will have more fun with the prequel, PROTOTYPE. Better story, better gameplay, etc etc...

content:
Posted: April 6, 2013
												It is basically like the first game, except a few differences:- it's a horribly broken port. It has everything from FPS issues, over bad mouse controls to random crashes on startup- the controls with a gamepad are much easier now, making the game much more comfortable to control- they took a lot of depth out of the move system, where in the first game you had to buy almost every ability you could have, from kicks, punches to your powers, there are less attacks now, which I don't like- the game is far too easy even on the hardest difficulty- the new voice actor for Alex Merver is far worse than the one from the orginal Prototype- James Heller is a moron who can't make up his mind- all the criticism aside I really like the new tendril power, but it's a shame that they didn't include the armor power from the first gameOverall I'd say it's inferior to Prototype 1, which "only" had a few issues with some minor mouselag and quite cryptic controls.

												" 가족을 잃은 흐켱의 복수  "( 딸 찾으려가던도중에 세계정복 하려는 악당들에게 얻어걸려서 막히는 스토리 )이게임은 완성도 , 중독성 , 몰입감 , 조작법 , 사운드 , 그래픽 , 잔인성 이다.1과 이어지며, 스토리는 탄탄하며, 왠만해선 영문판으로 해도 이해할수있도록잘만들어진 프로토타입2의 스토리 ㅎ내용은 프로토타입1 즉, 알렉스 머서가 젠텍사의 직원이엇는데그 회사에서 바이러스 하나를 개발했다.하지만 알렉스 머서가 그 바이러스를 가지고 도망을가다 블랙와치군대에게살해를 당할뻔하는 순간 .. 어찌 어찌 하다 프로토타입2의 주인공인군인 제임스 헬러가 그 바이러스의 첫주자가 된것이다.그로 인해 제임스 헬러는 자신의 그힘을 억제하지못해자신의 가족 마저 죽였다고한다.. 하지만 자신은 재대로 기억하지못하니.. ㅠ그러니 결국엔 제임스 헬러가 알렉스 머서를 죽이려고 하는 ..복수심 스토리가되는것이다.일단 게임성은 당빠 오픈월드식이다. ( 제일좋은 ㅎㅎ )하지만 .. 오픈월드 방식인데 .... 오픈월드같지 않은 게임!? 문도못열고 탈것은다니지만 그림에떡이고 에휴 ;;단순 파괴 액션 게임으로서 스트레스풀기에는 딱 좋은 게임 ... 중독성은 엄청나다. 방금전까지 하다가 끄면 또하고 싶을만큼..하지만 잘풀리다가 막히는 구간이나오면 질릴수도 .. ㅋ조작법은 1에 비해 많이 바꼈다고한다.사운드는 배경과 공간 , 시간에 비례하여 잘어울리지만 ..무기능력을 사용할때는 뭔가조금 부족한면이있었다.그래픽은 솔직히 1에서 2까지 3년이걸렸지만 그만한 변화는 거의없었다.한마디로 비슷하다는 .. 그래도 만족스러운 그래픽이였다 ㅎㅎ특히 피가 난자하는 씬들 , 물효과 , 불효과 모두 괜찮은편이였다.잔인성은 나를 실망시키지않았다. 사지를 찢거나 터지거나 갈라지거나 .. 허헣솔직히 어쩔때보면 소름이끼칠정도였다.. ㄷㄷ일단 게임성빼곤 대부분 다 그럭저럭 나쁘진않다 ㅎㅎ나는 이점에서 스토리가 제일맘에 들었다 ㅎㅎ" 괴물을 물리칠려면 .. 자기자신이 .. 괴물이 되어야한다 ... "

												9/10In the gore and blood honored tradition of the original, this game puts you in as a beast.  Just running and jumping around causes tons of collateral damage.  I leap off a building and surfed on some guy walking down the street leaving a gib laced bloody path.  Then I spent my first hour throwing people off the top of a building or into other buildings, splatting on impact like giant flies being swatted by gravity.  The game starts you with spiderman-like abilities and you only progress from there.  Absorb bosses and incorporate them.  BE the gvirus Tyrant, but with a better heart and conviction of purpose than William Burken.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Pretty awesome game!Ignore the people that hate the game because it won't load. AMD graphics cards aren't consistent, so any good graphics games (not just Prototype 2) will run like crap.Anyways on to the actual review -Presentation: The storyline is interesting, but Heller's constant anger causes a lack of character development. The cutscenes are very unique and finding locations in the map is fairly easy.Graphics: The graphics are pretty good, but they seem kind of old style. I think of Assassins creed 3/AC Brotherhood when i see the graphics.Sound: A lot of commotion goes on and honestly some of the stuff gets annoying to hear, but nothing beats hearing the sound of your enemy getting ripped in half.Gameplay: Your character is a badass which is what makes me addicted to this game. It's extremely entertaining to blow up helicopters and just kill everything. The only complaint is that you need the DLC to get 100% on the storyline.Lasting Appeal: The campaign isn't too long, but you'll stay busy with all the side missions and collectibes scattered everywhere.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												The core idea and story are great, especially for someone like me, a fan of horror films like Carpenter's The Thing, and someone who's always liked the idea of playing the monster in a game (whether misunderstood or just plain monstrous).They've continued the interesting atmospheric world from the first game, where the military is brutal and uncaring as a whole, the corporations are greedy and amoral, but both contain sympathetic and helpful individuals.And the gameplay is fairly simple, but somewhat challenging (at least on hard difficulty), and very good at making you feel like you're the evolved, shapeshifting, deadly soldier James Heller.Note that my longer list of CONS below just indicates that I saw lots of room for improvement... but I still enjoyed the game.PROS:- Great story.- A rare offering in a genre without many contenders.- Some beautiful, visceral attack effects.- Fun if simple gameplay.CONS:- The end battle really undoes the playstyle you develop through the rest of the game, sort of making you learn a new game.- Littered with sexism and anti-intellectualism... and not all of it can be chalked up to "But that's just how this character thinks." Some of it is fundamental to the game's overall outlook.- Some of the textures and modelling from the main game are too low-res for the in-game cutscenes. In those cases, they look awful.- Not as sandbox-y as the first game.- Character skills/customization is fairly broad and doesn't really let you specialize too much. So by late game, your character will play pretty much the same as any other playthrough.- As a result of the above two points: not much replayability.Rating: 8/10

Posted: May 5, 2014
												As someone who's played this game (as well as the first one) repetitively on console, I can confirm that, even with a rig that plays Battlefield 4 efficiently, and even with this game at LOW settings, the PC port for P2 is literally broken.  There are framerate drop issues everywhere, the main character doesn't even load at times (as if you're running around with an invisible man), and the game freezes when you use your Viral Sonar, which you acquire near the beginning of the game.I DO Recommend this game! However.... If you really wanna play this game, get it on console.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2016
												Gameplay-wise, this game is brilliant. It has the occasionaly problem with awkward camera angles, and an over-reliance on QTE's at a certain critical point, but, for the most part? It's a good sandbox game - the fighting is awesome, and even just moving around the map is fun.Story-wise, however... not so good. Right off the bat, fans of the original Prototype will mostly be alienated due to the protagonist of the original game apparently having gone genocidal at some point off screen - that's not a spoiler, by the way; it was in the advertising material.The characters... aren't. They are two dimensional archetypes, and two of the three times in the whole game we see someone act outside their archetype, it just feels wrong. I honestly have more of a connection with Mercer, and I'm not entirely sure if that isn't because I have him confused for the character I played in Prototype 1.Then there's the ending. Now, I get they had to leave it open for a sequel, but there is no sense of resolution. You can almost literally hear the dev's shrugging and saying 'We've kinda run out of ideas now'. It is beyond anti-climactic.So, in summary? Just play the first game again. The mechanics here aren't that much of an improvement, there's certain types of minigame missing, and you won't waste your time on a story that is bland at best.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												The game was a lot of fun. I find it particularly refreshing when a sequel is not just an imitation of the original game, but actually a new game altogether. I played Prototype2 immediately after Prototype 1 and the experience was completely different and, in my opinion, better. The controls felt a lot smoother in this one, the mechanics were more intuitive, hunting collectibles was actually achievable AND the rewards per collectible set were actually significant. The story was pretty nice too. The city looked particularly good, especially the red zone, with some really cool loooking damage to some of the buildings. I was hoping to witness some of that damage actually getting inflicted on some of the unharmed buildings, or some of that cool damage getting worse in an awesome cinematic of awesomeness and it didn't happen, but hey, that is a pretty small thing to complain about, which, once again, goes to show that it is a really good and fun game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 10, 2016
												Solid game, really improves on what the first Prototype was doing. Stories nothing amazing, but engaging enough. The action gets crazy at times with some seriously fast paced gameplay with smooth combat that mirrors the first but considerably more adaptive to situations given a nice and simple UI. It really emphasizes using various abilities in different encounters and the reward is there after you chop your way through several hundred infected, military and Blacksomething ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.It's also an excellent murder simulator.Pros:-Smooth like warm butter-Improves in just about every way over the original Protoype-Boss fights do what a boss fight is meant to do and that's test you on what you've learned so far-Big map with plenty to do. Side missions manage to not be repetitive.-Great UI for real fast ability changes-Some of the radio chatter is solid dark humor-Fun travel around a fairly large map with some variation between the three play areasCons:-The game does kind of hand out upgrades like candy from a windowless panel van just for doing a few sidemissions here and there-Combat can still be a bit clunky when there are a high amount of larger units being engaged-Heller, the character you play as, is about as interesting as a warm bag of moldy potatoes-You can become considerably overpowered late game, barring end game fightsGame runs fine on Windows 10, highest settings for this system on a 1080 screen, I'll put my system specs for comparison.MS-7850Intel Core i5-4670k 3.4GHz (4CPUs) overclocked @4.3GHz12288MB RAM (12GB RAM)EVGA Nvidia GeForce GTX 960 4GB

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												This is a really fun game if you can get past how stupid and unlikeable every single character in the game is.The open-world movement is lots of fun, combat is quite fluid and easy, and the game generally looks quite nice.You can eat innocent civilians for health, or just openly murder them without penalties, and all of the enemies in the game are part of a giant "conspiracy" to test viruses on the citizens of New York. There are literally thousands of soldiers and scientists that are in on it, which makes the conspiracy about as unbelieveable as is humanly possible. The main character is a "badass" in a sort of "we made a 10 year-old the lead writer" kind of way.Despite all of that, this game is lots of fun. I didn't have memory leak problems, but also have 16 GB RAM, so I can't comment on people with frequent slowdown. I think the game looks like any other last-generation-to-pc-port. Higher resolutions, much better draw distance, more shadows, etc, but in reality an engine that doesn't try to do too much.I'm having a great time 4-5 hours in, and it feels like i'm about halfway done the main story. If you like the game, get the "Radnet" DLC. It adds a bunch of fun challenges to the map - should really be included in the main game, but has no plot and is really just a bunch of superhero sports to try out.
