number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
												The game worked perfectly for me, not sure why other people can't run it.The game was a good and fun experience. Not as much of a thrill as that first time you learned each power in Prototype1, but it has its moments.Using stealth to avoid unnecessary combat was always my favorite option, but when I had to fight, I would always call in my Brawlers. Some might consider having five large allies as a mechanic that ruins the game experience, but you can always choose to go at it solo if you prefer.There were a few things I did not like in this game, but they were tollerable:Defensive misionsPowerless Blackwatch missionsTimed "collect the cargo" missionThere is always an easy way to win a fight and a hard way. The game lets you pick which one you want to try most of the time because it is an open world.The game encourages you to do side missions and level up because you become more badass and powerful with each upgrade. With the right upgrades, the game can become more and more fun.Glad I bought this game, I will revisit it some day when I want to run through both the games and relive everything again.

Posted: October 18, 2014
												I highly suggest to buy this game if you can handle some memory leak lag in-game, even if you have a strongest PC in the world you'll get A MASSIVELY LAGGING ISSUES in about 20-30minute playing it. This is not lying : I actually bought Prototype 2 last year (and it's a pirated version and CHEAPER) but there was no lagging issues seriously.Prototype 1 is actually quite more fun when in the free roam BUT Prototype 2 has the funnest, funnier(actually Prototype 1 seems doesn't have alot of sense of humour), actions on the Main Missions and Side Missions.Apart from that, Prototype 2 has alot of different features than Prototype 1. But, if you haven't play Prototype 1 yet and play Prototype 2 instantly, you have no problem (and you suck for not playing the first). The parkours are okay in Prototype 2 but this new "chasing the  Evolved]  system" are quite hard and sucked just because of it's parkours.Finally, you can't have fun in the free roam eg. you can't find any  Orion 1/ Super Soldiers  in the free roam, you can't find  Thermobaric vehicle , you can't fight/find  Evolved  to fight againts the millitary. You can only find them in the Main Mission and the Side Mission. Prototype 1 has everything you want to fight/use/enjoy what they have eg. (Weapons, vehicles, infected) except for the Hunter Leader and Super Mutant Hunter something. I actually still enjoying playing this game because of graphics.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												It is quite impressive how Radical managed to brake nearly everything that worked just fine in their first [prototype]. Let's start with the main character: Heller is just dumb brute and no amount of his dead loved ones makes him relatable. Mercer's quest for identity was nothig astonishing, but at least his lines were never this cringeworthy. And in no way he deserved to be made into this horrible kind of villain. Movement and fighting mechanics? Never truly shined the way they were intended to thanks to the broken lock on system. Movesets of each weapon are lacking variety and being able to use two at a time doesn't just scratch that itch. And most of the pleasant little details and moves were added only to RADNET edition. The story? Goes all over the place and gets nowhere without a sequel to deliver any catharsis whatsoever. Verdict? Play the first one and hope for a reboot. We need a decent [prototype] game on the market and we don't have one yet.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
												Absolutely abysmal port. Windowed mode (or a borderless fullscreen script) is needed to have anywhere near fluid mouse movement and smooth gameplay. Other than that, the game is...decent. It's nowhere near as good as the first game, though. The story makes no sense, the main character is completely unlikable and as illogical and stereotypical as it gets, and the gameplay is just not as good.The support for this game was literally abandoned before the game was even released, so that's saying something.Get the first game instead, it's a lot more fun.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
												The game ran horribly even before I got out of the start menu. Once I got into the game, I was smothered under an overlong cutscene that I couldn't even watch, because the lag was worse than trying to play League of Legends on a ten year-old laptop.Full disclosure: I am using a laptop, rather than a thousand dollar gaming pc. That being said, Prototype 2 isn't a new game by any stretch and isn't old enough to require special equipment to run. Also, my laptop has no trouble running games like Far Cry 3 and Saints Row IV, so the only conclusion I can come to is that the game is just poorly optimised.I also read somewhere in the comments that it won't run on Windows 10, but I made it past the point where the commenter said the game crashed on them. I thought I was in the clear and could adjust the quality if I needed to.On that note, when I finally managed to get into the menu after slamming the escape button and m key and any other button I thought might bring up the menu perhaps two thousand times each, I found myself looking for a thesarus, because the wording on the settings for this game are so technical, you'd have to study at MIT for four years to know what slider did what.To top it all off, when I set all of the ambiguous settings to low, and hit, "apply," the game crashed and I had to manually shut my computer down to turn the game off.If you have the fix for this sort of thing and you want to try your hand at getting it to behave for two minutes, then I can say that the brief glimpses of game that I saw through the horrible lag and buffering were very pretty. I can't be bothered to even look for a fix to this mess, however, because I'm afraid my computer might spontaneously liquify if I ever install it again.

Product received for free
												so this takes place a few years after prototype 1, alex mercer has went insane cause he tripped to much LSD in the last one, you play as a miltary dude called "James Heller" who is infected by mercer, thats all i really know cause i got a 100% save xD the side stuffs cool, like infected hives, blacknet challenges and stuff, and there is infected targets through the free roam who you can kill to get upgrades for stuff like helicopters to your own weapons and abiltys, it is indeed a step up from prototype 1 and side challeges still remains, something brought over from the first, what pisses me off is that they took most the powers from the first away and stripped it from 11 to 5, but the armor is in the skins that they added, you can even be alex mercer provided you have all the Radnet♥♥♥♥♥♥done, the skins have normal heller, a zombie heller, test heller, Infintry Heller (before mercer infects you), Armored Heller (If he had mercers armor ability), Armored Mercer (Looks changed from the original), and the normal variant himeself, also a zombie merceranyway this is most likely my most longest review ever..and some some pros/consPROS | Graphics, gameplay, altered New York from Prototype 1, Tendrills, Skins/Outfits ALEX MERCERCONS | Lack of powers cmon, 5 powers Prototype 1 had about 11. >:/ got this for the summer sale as a gift and i wont regret it :Dalso you can mod it by going to your prototype directory changing the exe fle to prototype2original.exe, put texmod in then call that prototype2.exe after this change the engine file to prototype2originalengine.dll

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												Let me tell you why I started hating this game. You see, instead going fair, the game changes your ♥♥♥♥ing controls during boss battles, you randomly fall through the floor, and some boss battles have non avoidable attacks right after the cutscene, just removing your health for no real reason. Oh, and did I tell you that you can fall through the floor? You can also change gravity and fall upwards, which is kind of entertaining. Or fall through the wall. There are many bugs in the game, and as such, it's not playable. Enemies instantly regenerate all their health by being stuck in an animation. Another fun fact - some of your attacks won't work on bosses. I'm fine with that, but if only the OP attacks work, then the boss battle turn into wathing the same animation forty times, due to the fight difficulty being the incredibly long health bar of your enemies.The good parts:+ The game runs smoothly.+ Free roaming is great.+ Carnage is fun in the beggining.+ When the game is not completely broken it's really fun...The bad parts:- ...but it is broken all the time.- Some of your attacks are completely worthless and some are incredibly OP.- Bosses use unavoidablr attacks to make your life miserable.- The plot is so stupid, I honestly prefer to watch Batman & Robin to it.- The main character is the biggest idiot in the gaming universe.- The plot twists that aren't even changing anything, while being obvious.- The mentality of most characters points to mental retardation.- Soundtrack is irremarkable, just generic action game music.- After some time, everything becomes annoying to the limit, expecially the collectables you need to upgrade.- Listening to the same lines over and over and over and over...

content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												Guys, this is a bloody mess.i do like that Game, unfortunately it doesn't work the way it's meant to be.I start the game, play an episode and expect after seeing it several times to stop at a load screen and to never come back. So it happens, that I have to play the same situations again and again until the game "allows me to go further".This is simply unacceptable. If I knew about it, I wouldn't even take the game as a gift.Unfortunately I paid for the Game.Is there anybody out there to take the responsibility and make sure that people who pay are able to play?Why do I not expect that this will change? Wasted Money!Thanks Activision! What a nice experience! UPDATEDownloading an UNCUT patch & installing it solved the issues.Surely the German language won't be supported. I don't care. At least the Game reacts now as it should be.Still I can't believe why this kind of issues are not been solved by Activision.UPDATE #2After I installed the patch successfully I was able to play the whole story including all bonus, Radnet games and to collect all items without any issues. I do love this game! Still the issues have to be fixed by Activision. full stop. To decribe what I downloaded: you have to copy two files to the Prototype 2 folder, as there are: "Scripts.rcf" and "Skuinfo.p3d". You can download them under:"http://www.gamecopyworld.com/games/pc_prototype_2.shtml"bestAndy

Posted: June 15, 2015
												HORRIBLE PORT!This game is just unplayable. I cannot even start the game and I have done everything I can, including updating the 'driver's which is a typical/copy-paste response for any technical team. I have the system able to run GTA V, come on! When I verify the game cache it always says that there is just one file that isn't right and it never downloads it no matter if I restart steam fully or restart my computer.Some say it is the graphics card and now I am beginning to think it is that... AMD has a LOT of problems running it, and funnily enough I have a AMD graphics card. AMD Radeon HD 6800 Series.Perhaps you may get it to work by disabling many things on your computer or buy a new graphics card, but if one person has to go through all that trouble just to start it, the game has some serious issues and possibly more in store. The developers don't even care to fix this problem as it has been a problem for some time now as I realized. I am not even sure why Steam is even selling this at all because it's a complete failure as a port to PC.Don't think the developers care as long as they get the $$$Thank god for refund options or my friend would be screwed gifting me this. Otherwise, I suggest getting the console version and play it on there instead and maybe then you might have some fun!

Posted: June 27, 2014
												This game was not ported well over from the consoles to the PC, and it really shows when you play it. The game itself is immence fun, focusing on openworld exploration and combat, with the main character having crazy genetic based powers. The game itself is all about speed and manuverabilityl, which makes the fact that you can not keep a consistent framerate in this game at all. This makes the game literrally unplayable when too many things are happening on screen. Prototype 2 is never gonna get fixed in any official capacity, and there is no consistent way to make the game run at a decent framerate. This means that for all intents an purposes it is fundamentaly broken and should not be played by anyone who values a smooth experience.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2014
												Story is good, combat gameplay is excellent, and the pacing is fine. The only real problem lies within the fact that this is a console port. Nvidia graphics cards have less trouble running the game, but most other cards like ATI have framerate drops to the single digits at random times, regardless of the quality of your other hardware.One more thing: RAM. Prototype 2 easily eats 3-4GB of RAM constantly. Do not buy unless you have 8GB or more. Occasionally, the game will hog all the RAM and CPU resources and freeze everything, including the task manager. The only known solution is to enter the task manager right after launching the game, and under Processes, Set Affinity to CPU 0 only. Even with this, the game can still become unplayable.tl;dr - Good game, poorly optimized port.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2016
												COMPLETED 100%Prototype 2 quite feels like a dumbed down version of Prototype 1 and is impeded by a lack of challenge in both enemies and gameplay structure. The story is pretty straightforward in this sequel and really nothing to be excited about.As advertised, you play as Venom... I mean Heller this time. A former marine who gets powers from the MC of the first game, Mercer. Eventually they both clash when Heller realizes who the real bad guy is. And that's pretty much how the game boils down to. Missions have taken a step backwards as disguising plays a more important role and you'll find yourself infiltrating enemy bases far more often. It could have been a good thing, if not for the fact that the devs doesnt seem to put much effort into this. The stealth aspect in this game is honestly, laughable. Marred by incredibly dumb AI that's beyond ridiculous. Soldiers see you flying in the air? Jump 100 feet in the air and drop right down? Nope, nothing out of the ordinary. See the infamous James Heller walking right in front of their face? Nope, they just see you as a regular civilian. But do something as small as jump over a table or hop over a comrade? Everyone suddenly goes into red alert. You don't even to silently consume people if you don't want to. Just grab the guy, consume him, jump over a fence, transform, jump back into the base 10 seconds later and everyone acts like nothing happened at all!The world of P2 is fairly large but is now divided into three separate areas: Red, Yellow, and Green Zone. Each having a different nature and scale of infestation, thus providing for some fresh scenes for free roaming. On the other hand there's only 3 kinds of interiors you'll ever enter in the entire game, and that's military bases, labs and infested lairs. Most of which are just copy+paste in appearance. Missions are where the game tends to get slightly repetitive, particularly in side missions. Find this, kill that, find that, destroy this. There's not much variety in what you do apart from causing destruction and mayhem everywhere you go. That's where the action comes in; it's still fun slicing up enemies and covering the streets in blood and gore. But it's too simple, because the game is that easy. Even worse, you have significantly less attack moves and powers to use, as compared to what the first game offered, which is another disappointment.Prototype 2 suffers terribly from many shortcomings but is still the same old enjoyable fun you can get for an open world title. Sadly not much of an improvement from the first game, if not, at all.PROS:- The Red Zone is pretty awesome in scale and magnitude- Venom/Carnage simulator- Blood. So much blood and gore. And explosions. Lovely.CONS:- A few power moves stripped down or removed from the first game- The same old Manhatten open world is nothing new- Sh*t AI stealth mechanics; escaping from an alarm or strike team is like a walk in the park- Too easy to beat- Game is very badly optimized for AMD cards, including forced enabled mouse acceleration in the game which can only be disabled through INI modifying

												I have never written a review for any game ever before, no matter how good or bad it was... but this one, this one just takes the cake.It's currently the worst game you could possibly buy on steam. Worse than Bad Rats. Worse than Day One: Garrys Incident.Worse than WarZ, DayZ or any other Pre-Alpha game that just wants your money and doesn't give a f*ck after that.Why you may ask? My reasoning is simple: Yes the titles mentioned before are an abomination to gamekind and a prime example of lazy developers who won't (or aren't capable of) producing something that manages to even come close to being worthy of what you pay for BUT AT LEAST you are able to start these games up and play them.Not so for Prototype 2, no. Your experience with it will be 5 mins of cutscenes and walking around at ~12 FPS (game hanging/freezing from time to time) before it ultimately crashes.No patch provided by the developers, no fix, no tweaking anything, nothing. I've done literally everything to try and make this junk heap playable, searched on steam forums and google but to no success.Imagine a casual gamer buying this pile of sh*t expecting a fun weekend experience. You might aswell bend over and ask Radical Entertainment to use a lot of lube.Did anyone playtest this crap before releasing it? I wouldn't be surprised if the time spent on making the PC-Port for this game was about as long as my playtime on it.F*ck Prototype 2. F*ck Radical Entertainment and everything they stand for.F*ck Activision. F*ck lazy Developers not giving a f*ck about gamers only wanting their money. content:
Posted: August 26, 2012
												Prototype 2 is an especially good action game where you play the role of sergeant Heller with lethal surpernatural shape-shifting abilities given by Alex Mercer. During the game Heller wants her daughter back and to stop Balckwatch and Mercer from destroying New York. Missions are excellent and contain a lot of fight against Mercer's creatures and Blackwatch elite troopers. You can consume almost everybody to gain health and to obtin memories that help you to understand better the story. In the city you can find collectibles to be found and liars to be cleared for mutators as a reward. Mutators give you superpowers and you can earn XP points by completing missions. As you level up you can open and obtain upgrades that make Heller more deadlier and give you advantage during the gameplay. The game ends with an epic fight against your creator, Alex Mercer. Prototype 2 has the "Radnet Access" pack dlc that gives you 5 unique abilities and 50+ challenges to complete. 8/10

content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												Problems I have with this game:So far, I've managed to play more than one and a half hours of this game, and not been able to get past the first mission (aka. the tutorial). During every cutscene, the game somehow seems to enter a state where it has to recalculate the entire environment or something. Actually, I don't even care WHAT it does during that time, because after every cutscene, I can bet my♥♥♥♥♥that I'll be stuck in an infinite loadingscreen, introducing me to another round of "start the game from square one".How to avoid this problem: so far, this problem never occured if I actually skipped a cutscene - but let's be honest here: I'm trying to get into the story of this game, and there is NO way I'm doing that without cutscenes.How to solve the problem when stuck in the screen: Just close the damn game. Just for fun, I've even left the game in a loading screen for a while today, just to see how long it takes to finish up loading. After one hour, I closed the game, because I realized that♥♥♥♥♥♥would not be progressing.I do not dislike the game itself, the concept seem fairly decent to me (so far). The problem I do have, is that the game is unplayable for me, which is (obviously) a huge let down - especially since I'm a huge fan of the first part of this series.

content:
Posted: April 13
												1) Essential purchase2) Recommended purchase3) Recommended purchase during a sale4) Not recommended unless heavily discounted5) Not even recommended for Steam game collectorsGreat sequel... meh portPROTOTYPE 2 is the sequel to 2009's open world action-adventure video game [PROTOTYPE], it pretty much keeps what made it's original game great, the over-the-top action, gore and combat. It's what really makes PROTOTYPE 2 a successful sequel and an overall superb game. Though it also has (just like [PROTOTYPE]) a really mediocre story, it's not exactly memorable, with the main character being forgettable alongside every other character excluding Alex Mercer, who was already slightly memorable from the original game.Now to expand on the story it's pretty much you start off as James Heller, a soldier who comes across Alex Mercer and tries to kill him, he doesn't succeed and gets infected by Mercer and hence the story of PROTOTYPE 2 begins from there really. And really after that point the story is forgettable, I care for none of the characters, sure the way the cinematics are made to look is nice but that doesn't I will be intrigued by what's going on in the cutscene, because it's just not entertaining to learn about. Now saying that I myself found the ending to be actually ok, it doesn't really elaborate on the after events, but the boss battle is really good at the end, even if it does seems to be the same as the others except with more health...And that leads me to the gameplay of this game.... my ♥♥♥♥ing god the gameplay is superb, this game alongside it's predecessor has superb gameplay, it's ♥♥♥♥ing great, just going around killing everyone with abilities you gain throughout the game, causing chaos towards the city of New York is just so satisfying. The fluidity of what you are doing is there, it's just so fun, you can go around in the Green and Yellow zones completely destroying bases full of Blackwatch soldiers or go into the Red zone fighting against all kinds of monsters created from "Blacklight virus". It's just so fun just going around destroying everything, and I could honestly say that it is as fun to do as in Just Cause 2 and 3, which PROTOTYPE has in some ways a similarity to.The graphics are ok, it's not brilliant but looks very much like a game from 2012, if you want a game which is graphically pleasing this isn't really anything special which is sadly to be expected as the engine was more so a improvement of the original [PROTOTYPE] engine for the gore and chaos instead of the graphics.The controls in this game are something to debate on, it's not bad but it's far from perfect, the controls are correct and it's all what it should be for a typical game on PC, but it feels at times that the mouse sensitivity is broke and that there is a mouse accerelation in the game that you can't turn off, it doesn't feel right and can get really annoying, but if you have a controller it won't be an issue as it seems to be extremely well there.... and that's a problem, because it also shows how this game was really not focused to be on PC, for christ sake the PC port took 2 extra months to release and just like everyone else is saying, it's a bad port, my PC build is a GTX 980, i7-4790k, 16GB DDR3 RAM, Windows 10, and I have seen on High settings an average of about 60-80FPS, sure it's not bad but this is a game from 2012, and worse of all if you have an AMD GPU/CPU you may not even be able to get the game running at all, and heck I consider myself lucky as Windows 10 users with NVidia GPU's have reported the same issue. And if you think this will be solved, well it won't as the developers pretty much shut down before the game was even released on PC! And it's a shame because if these issues were to be resolved then this game would be a solid buy.TL;DR+ Superb gameplay.+ A slight variety of areas for open world.+ Combat~ The graphics are only ok~ Mediocre Story~ Mouse Acceleration?- The PC Port is terribleOverall the PC port is a 6.5/10

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												My thoughts on the game having finished itI cannot even begin to describe how dissapointed i am in this game, and I say that with great sadness. I have only just finished it so I wish to put my thoughts out there while they are fresh.if you were looking forward to an interesting improved version over the origional Prototype you will be serverly dissapointed. if you want to have some more fun in the Prototype universe, go play the origional again and save yourself the pain.Credit where credit is due, Prototype 2 DOES look good, I will give it that. But thats about the ONLY thing it does better then the origional. It just feels as though the developers kinda.. well... dumbed it down for example the progression system in the origional was that you would earn EP (Evolutionary Points) through the main story and through doing side missions and then you could freely choose how you would evolve your character with a few story limitations (which made sence) and could unlock new abilities and combo moves.In Prototype 2 however the EP that you earn are directly channeled into a liniear level up bar where once it is filled simply gives you a level up point that you can choose to place in either:HealthRegenMovementMassFinishersand Disguise (which in almost completly pointless I might add)Once the point has been placed it simply gives you a straight up boost to the thing that you choose.... and thats it....how boring. Now before people go off at me YES you can do side missions to aquire "mutations" (selectable passives) but again that is quite boring and not worth going after as the game can quite easily be completed without aquireing more then a single passive...Another problem is that many of the enemies you will encounter are just re-skins. There are some new enemies but most if not all will instantly be recognisable which is a shame.most of these things I could deal with but what really put the nail in the coffin for me was *not really a spoiler*The final boss fight, Obviously you fight the protagonist from the first game (Alex Mercer) and I have to say it was one of the worst if not THE worst boss fight I've ever had to force my way through, because I refused to give up on the game after making it so far, but my GOD it was terrible.I like many of you I'm sure remember building up Alex to be the ultimate badass killing machine. Yet once you reach him, to destroy your maker.... it's just pathedic. The fight is a spam fest of dodging and back stabbing with scripted movements, camera angles and area restricting nonsence.First off. The spam. my GOD the spam. Yourself and Alex literally jump around each other constantly because many of Alexes attacks are unblockable and auto hit unless you are spamming the hell out of dodge. Then once you land behind him you back stab him a few times, then rinse and repeat.The camera angles kind of lead into the area restriction problem. you confront alex on top of a building and after having the whole game free roam, you are now restricted to this one roof top for the duration of this fight and in doing so the camera has to use funky angles just to try and keep up with all the stuff flying around the screen causing many, MANY problems and it is just stupid. Yes the origional did the same with its boss fight but at least it had a semi decent reason of being on an aircraft carrier and at the very LEAST that boss had minimal scripting and the fight was still "free roam"In all honesty it would have been better if they had just made Alex like the (minor spoiler) Evolved where they fought you around the city in free roam. It would have made the fight so much better.All in all I am dissapointed which makes me very depressed as I absolutly loved the first game and played the hell out of it, this sequal.... just makes me sad.If you are new to this universe go buy the origional and have a blast. If you are a fan like me? then just avoid this and go have fun with the origional again.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2013
												At first, this game looked to be a slightly upgrading version of the first Prototype: similar powers, better upgrade system, same silly story, slightly better gameplay.  Then out of left field comes the crippling framerate issues.  Apparently if you have an AMD graphics card, this game's framerate turns into a Powerpoint presentation as soon as one of the following things happens:1) It rains. (This happens fairly frequently.)2) A helicopter shows up. (Ditto.)3) The game just wants to ♥♥♥♥ with you. (I SENSE A PATTERN HERE.)Keep in mind that this is with the graphics set to the lowest possible settings.  Even then the framerate issues persisted, and I eventually just gave up.  I've jumped through MANY hoops to play good games (I spent nearly 2 days getting both Fallout 3 and Myst to work on my PC) but this game appears to run like♥♥♥♥♥♥for no reason whatsoever - I've tried multiple fixes on the internet but nothing has worked.I paid 15 dollars for this and regret it, because I didn't even get to play the whole damn game.  A huge disappointment considering that I enjoyed the previous game in the franchise.

												So basically to sum everything up: I LOVED the first game and I gave the second one a try a long time ago. So after purchasing a brand new PC last year I though i might give it another shot. SCREW IT!!!I spent the last 11 hrs trying everything to make this game playable. A refund is not possible. It wasn't after I purchased it and it is not now. Why is this game even still up on the market? It violates everything I know and yet steam has the only marketplace on this planet where broken stuff is being sold as brand new without refunds possible!And to the develpers (or rather Activision, since they propably put development on rest): Shame on you! content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												Very good gameplay and idea. It controls and looks well and overall is an amazing game. But in my opinion the story line isn't the best. I'm not saying the story is (on its own) bad, but I'm saying that it doesn't really work with the 1st game's story all that well. However if it was a standalone game and they just explained Mercer more, then it would be fine.  And it also seemed closer to gta or any other game like that rather than prototype in my opinion (gameplay wise). This kind of ruined it for my due to me getting so into the story of the 1st game. This makes my opinion mixed. If your looking for a good game to play and don't really care about the story working as a continuation or even as a sequel to the 1st game's I highly recommend this game. But if you want a great story instead this may not be the best. Although  while I cannont 100% confirm this (due to me having no trouble with keybindings or fps) most people say that there are alot of problems with the key bindings and fps.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												Everything is great until you come to the running side missions, as a common type of mini game, you have to run to collect packages, with each package collected extending ur time. While these seems normal, theexact amount of time you have and amount of time you get for collecting each package is just enough to get you to the end. Which means, if you acidenly go the wrong way, don't bother trying to fix your directon, just restart, since like I said before you have "just about enough" time. While this may seems like a minor annoyance, it seems the game devs loved to include this as a side mission, so I have to keep on doing these mission in order to gain perks. I think of them as hard as nails platform level, since if you make one mistake, it doesnt make sense to continue, you may as well just restart. Other than this, the game is epic, just fix this probelm game devs, and ill gladly give this game a thumbs up. (Also, dealing with rockets while trying to climb a building is impossible, if you try to block the missles, you fall, if you get hit, you fall, if u try to avoid them, you can't, leading to an almost impossible game of luck, not skill).Oh and also, can you disable the automatic manuver that happens if heller runs off the edge of a building (he throws himself off sideways). If you hit space 1 milisecond too late, he does this, and I have no clue what this manuver is useful for, when i go off a building, I either want to glide, or fall straight down. This stupid animation, stops heller from gliding for 2 seconds, by which time, you have lost a considerable amount of height, or you have hit the ground. In the side missions when you have to run from package to package, this single animation has made me have to restart a single running mission more than 50 times (it got to the point I started counted my restarts). There is not use for this animation, and all it does it makes a normal challenge into a touch as nails platformer like challenge, which if I wanted that, I would have turned the game onto hard, but im just playing on normal, so can enjoy the game and the story. This animation is almost like Heller deciding to take control rather than the player controlling him and unless it is a cutscene, I should be the one controlling heller.)

content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												I originally played this on a console and thought it was reasonably good, so when it popped up in the steam sale for next to nothing, nostalgia took over and i bought it. However, I wish i hadn't now.While the game is a ok'ish game, the performance issues make it unplayable and I had to uninstall. I have a good workstation PC with an i7, SSD, 32gb of ram etc... and even on all the lowest settings this games frame rate drops to unplayable levels. All the other 100+ games I have on steam don't have this issue on medium or high settings, so it must either be that the game is buggy or it's not liking a particular piece of hardware or software i have. Either way, I can't recommend in it's current state and like a few other games, I wish i could get a refund, but i know that will probably never happen on steam.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												This game itself is a decent sequel to a game built around a decent idea, however...the PC port is awful. You have screen tearing, memory leaks, random crashes every half hour, Any action, such as pressing a button too many times or taking a screenshot can send you crashing. Then you have to start over the mission you were on. Frustrating crap like this makes you hate the whole console driven market,The thing I hate about this "game" the most is that you spend 20 minutes on a mission, get to the final part of it - the video flashback .. and it crashes, so you have to start all over. It's a justice that this dev studio got disbanded.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
												Having already played Prototype, mixed feelings. Upgrade system is improved, but starting out with so many powers as opposed to gaining them organically makes being a superhero less special. Too easy to run/fly away from alerts. Conversely, couldn't finish the game because of a mandatory stealth mission. Didn't want to continue after losing to a giant tentacle or something which I could have killed if I wasn't responsible for babysitting the military while restricted to using guns that took several attempts to pick up and fire in the right direction. Only fun if you're content to ignore the story, screw around and throw civilians and military personnel across buildings, and you have Garry's Mod for that. Not enough bang for twice as much buck.

number of helpful: 16 of 37 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Welcome to New York Zero. The sequel to Radical Entertainment’s best-selling open-world action game of 2009, Prototype® 2 takes the unsurpassed carnage of the original Prototype and continues the experience of becoming the ultimate shape-shifting weapon. You are Sgt James Heller, husband to a deceased wife and child and a soldier left simply to die. As the game’s all-new infected protagonist, players will experience Sgt James Heller cutting a bloody swathe through the wastelands of post-viral New York Zero. Equipped with unparalleled new shapeshifting powers,players will gradually build a vast genetic arsenal of deadly new biological weapons and abilities as they hunt, kill and consume their way toward the ultimate goal – to kill…Alex…Mercer! Are you ready to murder your maker?

content:
Posted: February 26
												I would have given it a VERY weak "yes" for a recommendation. Then I finished the game. The final boss fight is the typical "let's take the game mechanics we've developed so far and throw them out the window". They disabled most of the useful moves, and turned the final battle into a 1 on 1 street fighter knock-off. Without the good moves or combos. Disappointed. A few years ago I'd have been angry, but these days a company screwing up the ending is kind of expected, unfortunately. Apart from that, the story is weak, although there's a couple of good turnabouts. The gameplay is somewhat repetitive as is the case in most "grind em till you got 'em" games that use side-quests to get gear and level up. The game mechanics and moving around is somewhat fun though, so there's that. Controls are definitely better than the original Prototype. Game was solid - only one crash, no idea what happened. So it goes from a weak "yes" to a weak "no" for recommendation. If there was a "meh" category I'd probably pick that, except for the ending.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												The worst story I've seen in a game... Ever... The gameplay is fun and enjoyable, I think everyone loves to run around butchering people and consuming them but when it comes to the story is when the game falls short. The story feels some what forced. Within the first 10 mins of playing the main protagonist joins Alex mercer who he originally believed to be the bad guy and fights against who he originally believed to be the good guys. There are plenty of plot holes as well, E.G. The priest you meet at the start of the game, who the hell is he? all we are told is that he knows things... HE IS A PRIEST!Anyway, te story is too forced, jumping from one scene to the next not really knowing whats happening. It's kind've like the beginning of Farcry 4.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												Okay, so this is a bit of a difficult one...The first Prototype game really captured my interest, but the city felt too small, restricted and indestructible.Thankfully in this game that is less of an issue, but i couldnt help feel that a great deal of the animations, and models were just recycled from the first game, with slightly changed textures. The enviroment was still invulnerable, even when blowing up something huge, and player impact on the city was minimal as the "city control" mechanic had been removed.That said the game did improve with more powers, More challenging creatures, and a (if slightly overused story line) good story. In P2 you get to control a pack of infected which is awesome, by the way.However even after consuming mercer you still dont get access to your own small personal horde, something players loved the idea of. Overall i don't actually reccomend this game, as it has done a "call of duty" Level offense. It's copied its old content and tried to sell it as new content.Heartbreaking.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												Only buy this game if it is on sale for $5 or less and you have an Nvidia graphics card. If you look at the steam forums many people with AMD cards can't even start this game.I was able to run this game on max settings, getting consistent 55-63 fps, only had a few drops below 50 but never below 40. Good - Fun action (sometimes ruined by the camera and controls)- Fun goreBad- Storyline, very predictable (2/3 through the story i had to start skipping the cut scenes due to the stupidity of all characters)- MC is very 1 dimensional, and can't jump, run, or do anything besides walking at normal (human) pace while on a cell phone -_-Horrible- Camera, I died many many times due to the camera focusing on a wall instead of infected I was fighting. The camera is so bad it actually ruined the last half of the game as I realized it was my main enemy.- Controls, in part due to the worthless camera and part trying to sneak up on a enemy who happened to be next to something you could pick up, you have a %50 chance to grab the enemy or grab the object breaking your sneak and alerting everyone.

												game was a complete let down compared to the first. All they did was create a small map, place a handful of missions & say done. That's all, no explanation what so ever about why Alex Mercer changed, or why he wants who he does at the end other then 'resilient blood' nothing else. To even further degrade the game I found they removed most the powers that helped you survive the first & only added a few new ones that are more to finish a mission then actually be useful. Even worse was the new guy you play as, he pretty much gets handed all his abilities in minutes, while you actually spent most the first game evolving to survive & gain the advantage other enemies, which actually helped extend the game and make it more enjoyable for players. Not to mention how he sounds overly dramatic at times as if he's actually good and not just a pitiful attempt at the dev's to recreate the first ones success. Overall this game is a complete waste of money & should of simply been made into an expansion for the first game than a separate one.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												It'll try to keep my review short this time.Combat i fun and seems varied but gets repetetive and unchallenging later on.The world is smaller and less interesting than previously.The rpg aspect is limited at best, and annoyingly it's impossible to fully develop your chracter in one playthrough.The main chracter is a huge♥♥♥♥♥amp;hole. Really, really a hatefull jerk. The daughter and family parts don't match the character you play and seem like they were added last minute to make him more likable, they do not. Seeing that that didn't work the makers of the game apparently decided to make Heller seem less like a collossall deuche, by making all enemies into even bigger♥♥♥♥♥holes. This i consider a cheap move which ruins any story. This is best shown in Mercer, who is out of nowhere a psychopath. I was most angered by that, as i liked him in P1. So yeah good going, P2 story team.All in all, Prototype is a good for a bit of combat, but not much else. I don't recommend it. Even if it is on sale, there are better games for you to play.

This allone makes it almost unplayable especially with checkpoints way to far of, so that you have to play some levels 3 or more times just to see every cutscene. And it has quite a few bugs that can occur some are gamebreaking (like events that make your charakter freeze up, but than nothing happens). The story looks quiete unoriginal and boring and the new protagonist just seems to be a more boring mercer. Old game mechanics are recycled but overall the charakter feels just less fun to play around with.To be fair i haven't played it that much and there is some kind of progression system in place, so that could change during the game.Also so many cutscenes that i wonder if they rather had made a movie than a game.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2012
												Welcome To New York, NY. A city yet again ravaged by a Bio-Nightmare created by the insidious Lab Corp known as GENTEK. In this Melee Survival Horror you are the protagonist James Heller. Heller who lost everyone that he loved thanks to then terrorist MERCER and the Blacklight Virus incident. Heller suffered a murderous breakdown for a long time but then was reactivated in the Marines & sets out to Destroy MERCER. MERCER infects HELLER and turns him to his side where HELLER quickly learns of a plot behind the 2nd Bio-Outbreak. Heller finds and takes advice from a Priest he knew from back in the day. During his journey he starts putting the puzzle pieces together to find those responsible and stop them. In the city he’ll travel thru “Zones” and tackles different missions to save people and absorb/consume Bio-Mass Monsters. He’ll level along the way and gain some new & somewhat similar but revamped Powers. With these new abilities will Heller be able to stop the Bio-Outbreak and save the city, or will he find himself a Patsy used for the next level of experiments.  Morph up, Strap down & get ready to find out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												Ok so I got this during the Activision sale 2014 for $10. The only reason I got this was because it said "shapeshifting" and I love those sort of power related games. Like Saints Row IV, which I strongly suggest as well. Now I went in hearing the IGN review which gave me low expectations. But OMG this game is great! And it has open world which in my mind is always great. It doesn't have a huge variation in what you actually do... But it's so much fun just running through the missions blowing sh#$% up. And to be quite honest the story isn't half bad (surprisingly). Now the powers are cool but it doesn't take a lot of skill to play. But I have spent quite a while running around putting bio-bombs in people! :) One of my few problems with the game is obtaining new powers takes forever! But past that game mechanics are great!!! Now on the technical side it doesn't take much to run the game which is good. And I actually haven't found too many glitches. +Lots Of Powers+Open World+Can Get Really OP+Just Plain Fun-Repetitive-Takes A While To Get Powers (can be overlooked)All in all 10/10

content:
Posted: May 11, 2014
												I give this game an 8.5/10. As someone who isn't a big fan of open world games like this, I can't stop playing it. The world is massive, I haven't come across a single terrible mission, there's constant opportunity to improve your character and unlock new abilities. Not to mention just traversing the city is fun on its own (running up the side of buildings, hijacking vehicles, gliding from rooftop to rooftop). This game improves upon the first in every way. If you're looking for an amazingly fun open-world game that makes you feel like a total mutant bad♥♥♥♥♥ look no further. This is the game for you.

Posted: September 10, 2012
												Plot is a mediocre retcon of the first, though the writing for the characters is good and manages to be entertaining. Gameplay is too easy, but the game gives you a ton of abilities to experiment with so it never manages to get boring during the 20 hours it takes to get 100%. Graphics and city design are better and more detailed than the first, though the city is now 3 zones separated by loading screens rather than being one large area.One of the better sandbox games this generation despite its flaws since it actually feels like a sandbox rather than an interactive movie where you do nothing but drive from point A to point B as is the case with most titles in the genre.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												Prototype 2 is a game that I want to love, but I can't,  A d yet for all it's shortcoming, I can't bring myself to delete from my gaming memory (or even say outright it sucks).  Prototype 2 is one of the WORST ports I have played, the textures suck, it is badly optimized, it lags even though I should easily max it out, and worst of all, it has a memory bug that makes it unplayable after half an hour of play.  And yet, there is something deeply saisfying about starting a map, running up buildings and gliding to my heart's content.  The misison structure is boring, the characters and story unintersting at best (offensive at worst), and yet...There is something about this game and its prequel that I can't get over.  Even if I go back and play it for a couple of minutes every couple of months, there is something almost intoxicating about being an unbound, powerful, gliding machine that makes me not ever want to part ot it.  And so I can only hope that one day I can find a game that will satisfy that same primal need, but that I can play for more than thirty minutes at a time.

												While this game is not without its flaws and shortcomings, I do recommend this game.  I thoroughly enjoyed the time I spent inside of this game. The story is a bit generic and they throw the same enemy types at you over and over again, but all in all I'm glad I played it.While I wouldn't drop full price on this game, if you are willing and able to preform some minor troubleshooting and restart it as needed the game is playable and enjoyable. Bottom line:The game is fun, the port is bad.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												James Heller is hell-bent on avenging his family's death, but Alex Mercer has plans for James that will change everything.James' has a better character background that players can sympathize or relate to.The same, straight forward HUD with an improved menu interface for navigation.The game play, characters, and universe are now on par with Infamous' great quality.A few powers have been replaced to chip away unnecessary skills, thus improving combat.The revamped levelling system rewards completion rather than farming Evolution Points.Same fun combat with faster skill mapping to pick the right tool for the job.Hunting mode was extremely fun, though it could have used more implementation outside events.The map has been extended and allows simplified searching for collectibles.Cinematics have had great improvements in quality, style, and purpose.The NYZ has had a graphical boost and no longer feels console-restrained.Fewer, new challenge modes require completion rather than perfection to earn fun upgrades.The soundtrack is as dull as it was in the original game.Compared to most, the difficulty was very low even on Hard.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 13, 2014
												Do not pay $39.99 for this. It's a good game. Its fun. But with how crappy it runs on my capable computer and how old the game is I will have to say that if I paid $39.99 for this game I would feel ripped off. This is a great sandbox game. Controls are amazing once you get used to them. Leveling up will grant you godly abilities to run, leap and glide across the city, slaughtering countless people who get in your way. I havent completed the game yet, but I do not feel like it will be too too extensive. Just a fun, turn it on and screw around game. I get pulled into the side missions and trying to get a gold rating. Very fun stuff to fine tune your skills. Also you get exp and new mutations from completion. Making it very much worth it to stay on top of the side missions. If you see this game for $9.99 or less, I would strongly suggest buying it. Unless your computer sux.*Edit* Just found out that it was my AMD video card that is causing all the problems. I also found a thread with a fix for the memmory leak problem. Search it up in the community hub. Value of game just went up.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												Prototype 2 is basically just more of the same. Some game mechanics have been slightly tweaked, but overall it's the same game with a different character.The story is paper thin and aside from the occasional insight into Blackwatch and the science teams fighting the infection, the story might as well not be there at all. Heller, like Mercer in the original game, has absolutely no regard for human life and basically turns into a killing machine the moment the game starts. Except for one situation in the game where he suddenly shows compassion for one single person. His one-liners are enjoyable but as a protagonist he does very little else to wow you.The virus, mutations, upgrades, weapons and shape shifting are the bread and butter of this game. 99% of the time you will be hacking, slashing and impaling Blackwatch soldiers and infected alike with your shape shifting blades and other goodies. As you progress through the game these weapons will become more and more powerful. If you take the time to do side missions this gets to a point where Heller becomes completely overpowered and is able to easily kill anything that gets in his way. Some upgrades even make you immune to small arms fire, making it possible to ignore the majority of the military all together while avoiding rockets.While this kind of power is very fun to play around with, it takes away just about any challenge the game had left to offer. Any enemy that can't be killed in 3 hits can easily be avoided and with a huge surplus of consumeable people around you will never (ever) run out of health. While I played the game on Normal, I can't imagine the game being any more challenging on Hard.It's still a very fun game to play around in. But if you are looking for a solid story or a game that offers a challenge then you best keep searching. This is basically a hack and slash version of GTA and nothing more. Recommended to get when it's on sale.

												Okay, let me start off by saying: this game will make you feel like a god, it is incredibly fun, action packed with a decent story. SPOILERS BELOWIt starts off with you finding out that your daughter and wife were killed by these new Blackwatch soldiers, and as marine James Heller, you are thrown right at Alex Mercer at the very start of the game, later he injects you with his abilities (no, you dont get all of them all at once.... I know, i wish you did to) the Blackwatch soldiers capture you and figure out what makes you tick, fast forwarding a lot (to make this review a lot shorter), you find out that your daughter is still alive and was captured by Blackwatch, so what do you do? You got full on ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥crazy, you go after her... but are stopped by Alex Mercer himself, he is the final boss of the game.. and he is one of the BEST boss fights in video game history (in my opinion) it took me almost an hour to beat him, and that was probably a lot of tries, he adapts to some of your attacks and attack patterns, which makes this boss fight even more awesome, but when you beat him, believe me when i say it will feel so damn good, sorry im cursing, but there is no other way to really describe it, after you beat him you go get your daughter and rescue her, and the ending is very satisfying, my final rating for this is a 7/10, it is a great game, but there are several things the developers could have improved on, i highly reccomend this game, even if you dont know anything about the series, i enjoyed this game so much and i wish they would make a Prototype 3, but onfortunately the studio that made this no longer exists. Do yourself a favor and get this game

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												Prototype 2 has a completely different playstyle as compared to 1 In terms of the ability tree. Unlike 1, P2 is much less confusing with less item on the power wheel and more focused on one-butten skills rather than P1's massive array of combo. However there's still cons when you actually spends time on this game. One such con would be equipping two ability for both mouse buttons. Prototype 2 does not have much of a combo and is more on the charged 1-hit to take out non-human targets. So having a second mouse button is next to useless if you're a power mixer. Right, even if you DO managed to fork out a combo, you've probably fail 3 in a 4 chance because the evolved were too fast or brawlers cannot be stunned during their onslaught. Last but not the least, removal of human disguise ability. Why!? D: the air strike was so fun, I know Heller wasn't as sly as Mercer so why did the air strike have to go with Patsy? T_T Gone with the con, it's getting long but the pro arrives! Heller's whipfist is an automatic field sweeping tool that is easy to use as compared to P1, although range is not as long. His's hammerfist doesn't have the rocket launch but makes up for it by having the stun ability to stun almost everything. Controls were much better whe gliding is much easier and vehicles were much better than before. There's much more pros but it's best to find them yourself as you enjoy the game.Additional details of the recommendation: I've recommended the game not only because of the story, but other features such as tearing off vehicle's secondary weapons and the side stories from those trucks. If you so happen to also consider getting the radnet pack, those are also a fun add-on to play with as it offers additional abilities that can assist you in the story further, or to let you screw up the game entirely once you're done.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												Just finished Prototype 2 last night, and I fully recommend it to anyone looking for a fun open-world action game that is not GTA.  The storyline moves along at a great pace, keeping power-ups and progression within an hour or two of each other.  There's no unnecessary padding to the main questline, something that really bogged down Darksiders 2 for me.  That being said, however, there are enough side missions to keep you busy for double the time I spent in game.  A couple of standouts for me include both the side missions and the powers at your, James Heller's, disposal.  First with the side missions.  I don't think I've found a game outside AAA RPGs like Mass Effect and Elder Scrolls where side missions were so beautifully related back to the main storyline.  Each mission involves another piece to the puzzle of the main storyline, fully fleshing out a bleak and believable alternate reality if you choose to do them.  Another cherry on that sundae is that every side mission serves to enhance a power that you already have- instant gratification.  No matter how much I wanted to stick to the main story, I couldn't stop doing the side missions.  And the powers.  Boy howdy, those powers.  Think Spawn had a devil's three-way with the Incredible Hulk and Predator.  Nowhere else have I felt like a force to be reckoned with, something that couldn't be stopped.  And then I died a bunch.  With every new mutation and bioweapon handed to you in game, along comes a new enemy variant that can slap you down without careful use of all your resources.  And never once did the game feel cheap- I just had to adjust my playstyle from what I had been using for the previous hour or two and the problem was completely manageable.  Bottom line- top marks for Prototype 2, a heartfelt and desperate journey of a loving father consumed with the dirty fires of revenge and bedlam. Try this one out if you like:-great sci-fi-a strong lead character-that game "Hulk: Ultimate Destruction" for PS2 and XBox-compulsive overeating to gain the strength of your enemies

												So just to make the record clear on this... I spent many more than 7 hours in this game, but didn't have internet when I did most of it. Most not logged. It's virtually impossible to beat this game in 7 hours... Ultimately, this was an intense, gears of war meats mutation and spider-man's trek through new york, or some wannabe version of it, gorey experience of mayhem, destruction, and "eating" enemies to gain knowledge while contantly building on a sense of rage as life as one knows it changes from within him, til he finds the human instinct reclaiming the fabric of his sanity and trying to hold onto it so the paradise of childhood innocence can continue despite the horrors of the world wrapped in cherry syrup. Challenging, fun, really neat game. Definitely would recommend.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 9, 2013
												6 / 10The main character of Prototype 2 is James Heller, who is out for REVENGE! And won't stop telling you that every 5 minutes. He's also very angry. We can tell he's angry because he keeps saying f*@! every. Single. f*@!ing. Sentence.The game does a good job empowering the player with interesting and visceral mutations, which are gained by killing mutants that have powers you want. Power and ability progression is dealt with quite well mechanically and employing the various powers is rather fun. However, press the wrong button or take slightly too long to interact with a quick time event, which boss fights are unfortunately made of, and all that empowerment is stripped away for one jarring moment as the game remorselessly punishes you by stripping up to a quarter of your health away. Despoite the fact that you can punch helicopters out the sky and kick tanks to death.The story is an unfortunately flat follow up to Prototype 1, where Alex Mercer (the player character in Prototype 1) is suddenly, inexplicably, mustache twilingly, top hat wearing, puppy kickingly EVIL. He wasn't a nice person in the first game, but the sudden change in character is very jarring and poorly executed."How do you know I'm EVIL James Heller? Because I will tell you so while twirling my mustache! Mwa ha ha! Let's take over the world together.""No Alex Mercer! Mutants killed my fambly! You are a mutant so I shall kill you too. You f@"!ing emo."The best character interaction Heller had was when he called Mercer emo. Which was unfortunately during one of the worst QTE fuelled boss fights I've had in years.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												Remember all those nice things I said about Prototype 1? Well this game has all of that and more.The graphics are vastly improved. Prototype 1 looks like a PS2 game in comparison. The story isn't as good this time around though, as the plot seems very barebones and a lot of sh*t just plain doesn't make sense. I would also like to point out that I did get this feeling like the game was very "disconnected" from Prototype 1, in that it ignores or leaves behind a lot of the events that happened in the first game (for example, I don't think Elizabeth Greene is mentioned a single time). The final boss fight is amazing too a provides and adequate amount of challenge but it's worth noting that this game is overall much easier than the first. This isn't necessarily a bad thing as it makes the freeroam MUCH more enjoyable, but the campaign itself did feel a little lacking due to the lower difficulty. Also, side note, I miss Alex Mercer's voice actor from the first Prototype.Anyway, just like the first game, Prototype 2 has fantastic sandboxing. This time around, there's 3 islands to go travel between, which includes the completely infection infested red zone. And just like Prototype 1, you can parkour around the city, murder the undead and play around with the military (you can still play "Events", but you need the Radnet DLC pack for them, which kinda sucks). One of my personal favorite things to do is go in the Red Zone and rescue hapless civilians from the streets by grabbing them and dropping them off safely at a rooftop. If you had a bad day at work, there's no better place to go than Prototype 2.My biggest problem with the first game was that vehicles kinda killed the fun of the game. Tanks spawned like crazy around you during freeroam and strike teams were called in like nobody's business. I'm happy to say that the problem's been fixed in this one; squads of tanks no longer spawn around you while you're just trying to have some fun and strike teams are much rarer and don't get called in in quick succession anymore. Furthermore, both seem to do less damage and are much easier to take out now, thanks to weaponizing them (ripping off the minigun/rocket launcher from the vehicle) or just grabbing onto them and using a finisher (which instantly destroys the tank/helicopter). Also, with the adjusted leveling system, as well as the introduction of mutations, you can truly feel unstoppable as you tear through enemy after enemy with your arsenal of biological abilities.With all that in mind, I think it goes without saying that Prototype 2 blows Prototype 1 out of the water in the spot for the ultimate bad*ss simulator.One last thing, I noticed a lot of people with AMD graphics cards are having issues with the game. I myself use NVIDIA so the problems are irrelevant to me but I feel I should still point out that people running games on an AMD should be careful and do some research before buying this game. Most of the negative reviews for Prototype 2, after all, are people who can't even get the game to run or start properly.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												I found this game, while deeply enjoyable, to be not quite as good as the original, and I'm having trouble figuring out why.  The characters are more interesting, the gameplay is more intuitive, the visual asthetic delivers the feel of a city truly experiencing a disaster of this level where the first game failed in that regard.  I suppose that my real problem is that Heller feels invincible, while Mercer felt very vulnerable in the first - and he survived a nuclear warhead from a few meters away.  The sandbox is smaller, the new enemies feel a little tacked on, and none of the bosses really inspire that gut wrenching terror that you got in the original Prototype (none of them made me want to toss my computer out the window either, and the first game definately brought me to that precipice).All in all, it really delivers a long, fulfilling and well rounded experience.  Oh yeah, and you can rip a tank in half with your bare hands if you level your character right.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												Prototype 2 is similar to Prototype "overall" - ie: an open world sandbox where it's fun just doing whatever you want. The main problem with Prototype was that the first special offensive ability gained was pretty much all you needed to use for the rest of the game, so the other offensive abilities don't get much use. Prototype 2 is much more 'balanced' than the first in this respect, but now the game holds off giving you the (overpowered) offensive ability from the first game, until "after" the final battle - meaning that there is nobody left worth using it on!That aside, it is a fun sandbox game with just enough to keep people coming back after the campaign is completed...

content:
Posted: December 25, 2012
												This time we're hunting Zeus! I mean Alex!Graphics are sort of PS2 or PS3-ish, not the best. Crappy textures, crappy polygon count. But a beautiful game none the less. Thank you, HLSL!Soundwise: meh, voice acting is decent. Hard to say when almost everything is this unemotional military speak.Gameplay is amazing! Very graphical violence, I like it! Fights are fluid and fun. You still have this feeling of godly power, but fighting bigger enemies is a ton of fun!One thing: this game has a memory leak bug. Since the team around Prototype 2 have been dissolved you will not see any offical patches for this, so here is what it is: RAM is being filled up until ~3.5GB and the game crashes. Fix: minimize the game every 1-2h once. Yes, this fixes the problem.Still an amazing game! Did not regret a single minute! BUY IT! NOW!

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												I am usually not a fan of parkour-based FPS games, as they often require a lot of coordination.  Nevertheless, this game is different than games like Dying Light as far as parkour, which is a breeze in Prototype 2.  The RADNET DLC is a must-have for more casual gamers given the incredible abilities it can provide.There is certainly a storyline, though it is rather predictable.  Nevertheless, I find the gameplay is absolutely amazing and I reallly enjoy the destruction one can create on such a massive scale!  As far as the original Prototype, I played it for a bit, but personally I feel Prototype 2 has a richness the original lacks.Nonetheless, that is simply my personal opinion.  Being an older and more casual gamer, I tend to gravitate towards games with difficulties that can be more easily scaled like this one.   After only a day of playing, I knew this would end up on my "Favorites" list.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												I didn't find this game as rewarding as the first. While there was considerable expansion to the powers and the abilities, the game length was somewhat short. The storyline was not very cathartic, but that is a completely subjective judgement.Pros:Good GraphicsFast ActionGood use of standard blend of powers.Open worldCons: Seems to be having trouble running on modern systems.Open World is very static.Side Missions become repetitive very quickly.Confusing storyline delivered through questionable menu.All in all, the whole game seems like a redo of the first, with less work put into matching the story to the side missions and using the latter as a generic skeleton to hang a thin coating of story over. Saints Row IV did similar. The people are even more distant and inaccessible from the players point of view, and the game's response to the player is limited, so it becomes very simple to determine what will happen, and the military always seems to be keen to open fire on you often sometimes without reason.Is it fun? Yes. Is it worth the price?I would get it on sale.A big sale.

												Prototype 2 is a rather exciting game! The characters are awesome,the powers are friggin awesome! (I'm looking at you WhipFist!) everything is awesome in this game! Now,It definitely does not match up to the first game,but that doesn't mean you shouldn't get it! Now there is one problem with the game.....it has severe memory leaks. Incase you don't know what those are,memory leaks cause the game to use up more memory without expelling excess memory. Basically,it lags,FPS goes down ALOT,and it crashes. Not your typical lag,it makes the game unplayable. However,this problem is only on the PC version. If you want the game,get it for the XBox360/PS3! To sum it all up,get the game,but not for PC. It will consume hours of your day!Have fun!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												Life got you down?  Could you use a good power trip?  Want to play a character that can throw cars, run up buildings, leap and glide long distances, devour your foes then disguise yourself as them to infiltrate their world, and turn your arms into powerful weaponry?  Look no further than Prototype 2.One warning: this one's definitely not for the kiddies - this game is full of mayhem, and the main character uses cuss words liberally.  Prototype 2 is open-world, with a main story, many branching side-stories, and lots of bonuses to earn you more POWER!  You start out incredibly powerful, then proceed to ridiculously so - run up a building, leap from the top to the combat chopper that's blasting you, chuck the pilot out the window and take it over yourself, or just leap out and glide, watching the chopper drop to the ground.  Or, after devouring (with tendrils) a biowarfare scientist spreading the plague, run through the city in your lab coat, chucking cars at the Infected monsters.  You have definite missions along each story path, but a lot of freedom on how you want to do it - do you disguise yourself and quietly infiltrate, or decorate the walls?  Do you protect the public to the best of your ability, or drive your tank OVER rush-hour traffic?  You're not forced to be a good guy or a bad guy, though overall your goal is to end the bioengineered plague spreading throughout the city, turning people into monsters.Now that I've also played Prototype 1, I can say that 2 improved upon the gameplay greatly, and the beginning catches you up on that story.This is a great game to play when you've had a bad day.P.S. I defeated the game and earned all the DLC rewards I could on the PS3 before my YLOD ended that - I've only just begun on the Steam version, and it's even better!!

content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												Like the first Prototype, this game allows the player to kill everyone in a multitude of very satisfying ways. It's too bad some features from the original aren't there this time around- air strikes, patsy, armor, and hanging onto walls like Spider-Man, to name a few. Unfortunately, it's impossible to get all upgrades in one playthrough so if you're looking to fully upgrade Heller, be prepared to play the story twice. Boss fights start out hard encounters but after acquiring many upgrades, Heller can go to town on them like nobody's business. There are even upgrades that let you destroy tanks and helicopters with one button after hijacking them. In the rare case you get overwhelmed in a fight, just summon your pack of Brawler Hunters and you win. The only real challenges are the Goliaths and the last boss fight. Prototype 2 is still a very fun game though.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
												Loved this game. Yes it has a memory leak for pc but dont let that discourage you! The game changes up some things from the first game that didnt work well. One was the minigames; screw those and just have them integrated into the missions. Make enemies easier to consume when they're at low health. Have new game changing abilities, all of which you will use and be encouraged to use. A little more help to get you through the game easier. It might seem like a little much at first but believe me as someone who is a slow learner, it's worthwhile. I loved the perk system and level up system. Unfortunately there isnt a counter for body count anymore or any reason to randomly kill military but you get everything with the second playthrough as long as you do some searching around the city. One suggestion that I wish I knew going into the game: THE MAP HELPS YOU FIND BLACK BOXES, DENS, AND FIELD TEAMS! The general area is pinged on the map if you have something undiscovered. Use this info to your advantage! It can be found under collectibles in the map tabs.My favorite ability is the Bio-Bomb! I literally spent 2 hours alone playing around with it. There is also a RadNet change to it that allows you to kick those you bio-bomb square in the♥♥♥♥♥toward your target! It's fantastic. It allows me to stealth missions easier while removing detectors to move around easier. I used it a lot to stealth kill tanks and helicopters ahead of time for missions. Totally the most useful skill out of combat and can be used for fun in combat as well.Happy hunting!

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												Prototype 2 is fun to play. Prototype 2's story and characters are fun to ignore. The comparisons to the Infamous series are apt - both are games about genetic mutants being hunted down by insidious government organisations, and fighting back for their freedom and the truth. Both also contain protagonists that are pretty unlikable, although Prototype makes no attempt to try and morally pigeonhole your character. While the first Prototype is rather clunky and dated both technically and graphically, Prototype 2 is a significant improvement on both fronts. However, like the first game, Prototype 2 is still full of trite dialogue, repetitious gameplay and a plot that tries for complex and dramatic but comes off as convoluted and melodramatic. The player character is a vicious, angry piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥who is supposedly motivated by the death of his wife and child, but is (and I suspect always was) a callous psychopath. Your character is told about 6 hours in to be careful of losing his humanity. I then continued to slaughter innocent and guilty alike, just I had for the entire 6 hours up until that point. The good news is that the game makes few attempts to cover up the fact that it's basically a playground for the player to commit innumerable brutal, violent atrocities against anyone standing in their way. The game doesn't hold back when it comes to gore, and the player is given a large range of powers almost straight away, so you can expect to be running, jumping, gliding, and tearing opponents (or civilians, if you feel so inclined) limb-from-limb from the moment you set foot in the world.In reality there is only one type of mission in the game - you consume a person, gain information from them that leads you to another person, place or thing, and then you destroy that person, place, or thing and escape the area by disguising yourself. Bar some minor collecting, everything else that happens is some variation on this, which would be a bad thing if you weren't given the freedom to wreak havoc with impunity. The enemies are basically blind, and all you have to do is turn a corner and disguise yourself and you're a free man, not to mention the fact that you can consume people who are standing right next to someone else as if peripheral vision doesn't exist in this world. But this just serves to lighten the restrictions on the player.I wouldn't recommend the first game, but I would recommend this as a guilty pleasure. Be aware that it does get repetitive, so get it cheap.

												Plot is a mediocre retcon of the first, though the writing for the characters is good and manages to be entertaining.
